description:
What a feast we had here. 
Top notch authentic flavors and exceptional quality ingredients. 

If you ever wondered about a roll or fish and been hesitant to try, this is the place to try them. 

See attached photos for our saki choice and some of the items ordered from the menu. 

Neat and clean spot. Nice vibe. 
No sushi bar with sushi chef. They have a regular bar is instead and sushi is being brought to you. 

Parking is not easy in the area. Plan ahead.
author: Zita M.

description:
Not all that impressed. For same price point, there are far greater options in the neighborhood in terms of quality of sushi and overall experience. 2 spots come to mind that are a few blocks away. Feel free to DM for more info.

The rice was not sticky enough (crumbled upon picking up with chopsticks) and fish quality on nigiri was mediocre. I had to request twice for plates, which we didn't receive until halfway through dinner. Best thing was the gyoza (at a sushi spot).
author: Alex B.

description:
I don't get the five star reviews. Came here for a birthday dinner with family and it was not a good experience. First the restaurant is super loud and has music playing for no reason since it can't be heard. The service is terrible. I had different people bring my food and water, I had to ask for more water as my server never came by to check. Also they only filled the glass halfway, huh, why wouldn't you fill it up all the way. It was a small glass to begin with? There are only 7 or 8 tables full as we took up 3. The food was bland for the most part or gross. The Las Vegas roll was tasty with the cream cheese but that is all I tasted in it. Plus it was super small for the price. The katsu which my mom ordered was nasty and bit sour, which I assume was the sauce. The rice even had an odd flavor. The portions are super small and regularly priced. The real kick was they ran out of cocktails before 8. It was still 7 and they had no cocktails. What the heck? How do you run out of cocktails before the dinner rush? Also the bill comes with a 23% tip and place to add more tip automatically add. Wait why 23 you maybe thinking, well 20% for crappy service and 3% for health insurance. Wow what a scam.

My sister loved the place, well she can have it. I won't be back.
author: Gregory F.

description:
Really good presentation. Good selection of Sake. 
The special edamame is really special.
author: Kimia P.

description:
Rolls: A-
Service: A-
Coleslaw: C

Solid neighborhood sushi spot for rolls. Don't expect anything crazy, but far more reasonable than the $100 Omikase that is taking over the city. 

Everyone working there is nice and attentive, but at some times they are understaffed and thugs can take a while.
author: Barron C.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here on a random weeknight to eat dinner since I was in the area. It was pretty late, so the restaurant was almost empty except for a rowdy table of dudes lol. 

We ordered the sweet scallop roll, torched salmon, and white sake tempura roll. The white sake tempura came out first. It's more of a thicker roll with salmon and avocado, wrapped in seaweed and lightly fried. I liked it and the sauces that came with it. The torched salmon and sweet scallop roll came out shortly after. I thought the sweet scallop roll was tiny in comparison to sushi places we usually go to. But it was delicious because I love scallops. The torched salmon is self explanatory--seared salmon with sauces. It's also wrapped around an avocado slice, which is a great complement to salmon sashimi. 

Service was extremely friendly. I liked the sushi, but we weren't that full after 3 dishes.
author: Tara A.

description:
When in San Francisco sushi is a must!  Being surrounded by a plethora of sushi restaurants, it is difficult to know which one to go to.  Enter Tamashisoul Sushi Bar.  On first impressions, this place is like many sushi bars I have been to in the past.  The place was dimly lit with a minimal number of tables and a bar.  I noticed two sushi chefs quickly preparing fish for a number of patrons who were already seated.

We were greeted by a young gentleman who was super down to earth and made suggestions here and there.  Since we were comfortable with the menu, we just dived right in and ordered a number of things.  Other than the wonderful salad, the nigiri and the quality of fish was amazing.  If any fish was super fresh then this place had it!  We had red snapper, tuna, salmon and even halibut nigiri.  My mouth is watering as I'm typing this!

Highly recommended to sit at the bar and look to the right.  The sushi chefs are doing their thing.  I saw them grind away at real wasabi which you can get for $3USD and its something I would recommend ordering!  If the sushi chefs weren't preparing sushi, they were sharpening their knives and preparing rice.  Always on the go! 

Can't say enough of this place except it'll definitely be a stop when we return to San Francisco!  Go for the nigiri and stay for everything else.  This place is excellent and would recommend it in a heartbeat.  Kampai!
author: Alex L.

description:
On the prowl for some sushi this past Wednesday night, I took the lead for my party of five and came across this place via Yelp Reservations.  It had availability for the time we were seeking, so a couple of key strokes later, we were confirmed.

We were seated promptly upon arrival and greeted by our server.  Note: there is wine, beer and sake, but no hard alcohol on the menu.  We ordered some drinks and some edamame for the table, followed by a bunch of rolls and some nigiri to share.

We had one non-sushi eater at our table and she went with a steak noodle dish and seemed pleased.

The family style sushi was good, but nothing extraordinary or super memorable.  It was all fresh, some presented beautifully and others not so much.  The decor in the restaurant is pretty simple and has a casual feel.  The prices seemed reasonable and I was in good company.  

This place is A-OK and I would return if I were in the Marina/Cow Hollow area - it's super cute.
author: Gabi M.

description:
Until recently this was one of our favorite restaurants - a wide variety of high quality, delicious and authentic cuisine. But a makeover into   omakase-style with a more limited menu and focus on "high quality fish only" (and seemingly higher prices) proved to be a disappointment. All of the grilled food items we liked were removed from the menu. The mushroom miso soup was still flavorful but the serving dish was downsized. While the sushi roll was still tasty, the sashimi salad was poor. The salad was rough and tasteless with the inappropriate addition of tomatoes, blackberries and raspberries. It seemed thrown together without much thought and no integration of flavors. The green tea seemed watered down. 
So this restaurant has gone from double thumbs up to thumbs down and we likely won't return. Good restaurants just don't seem to last, as someone always tinkers with success.
author: Michael B.

description: Started with the Avocado Bomb, then ordered the Tamashibow, King Salmon, Lion King and Crunch Dragon. All very tasty. For desert I highly recommend the mochi. The service was nice too. Cons: the place has a funny smell and tables are a bit sticky. Still deserves 5 stars for the great food.
author: Rafic K.

description: I love the rolls I ordered but it was a bit pricey. Came because i was in the area and the Yelp reviews were great. The sashimi app was a bit small but tasty. Loved the lobster roll!
author: Mitzi W.

description:
Color me impressed. A late night sushi spot with some legit fish quality and variety of food options on the menu? Hell yeah!

The group decided around 10pm on a Saturday night that we needed food. But not just any food - some good food. And Tamashisoul Sushi Bar delivered on quality of food and service. 

We got everything from sashimi on a chirashi bowl to speciality rolls to a bowl of seafood udon. The only knock I had on the whole thing was that some of the rolls were def for show. There was one that was lit up and "cooked" at the table. Unnecessary for me, but it was cool nonetheless. 

Overall, had a good experience. An even better one than I expected for sushi at 10pm. Will def be returning. 4 stars!
author: Jennifer L.

description: For a city where every single restaurant seems to have crappy service, Tamashisoul is spot on with the service game. My husband and I stopped here for second dinner on our last night in SF (don't judge, its our thing) and couldn't have been happier with our experience from beginning to end. We sat at the bar and ordered from the sushi menu, we were bummed to see a number of things 86'ed but it was towards the end of the night so understandable. They have real wasabi which I totally worth the $3 If you've never experienced it. We started with the red snapper tataki which was perfection! The red snapper melted in our mouths and we contemplated ordering a second round but went for nigiri instead. We got salmon, eel, yellowtail and red snapper and it was too legit to quit! Being landlocked in Colorado has given me a new appreciation for fresh fish and sushi and Tamashisoul went above and beyond our expectations! They guys working the bar were awesome, we got stellar service from a 19 year old which totally wasn't expected. Definitely stop here!!
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Service here was actually terrible, and it was by no means intentional or due to ill-training, but due to understaffing issues. We came with a moderate size group (about 8) and there were orders missing and food being delivered in awkward segments (where half of our party had received their dishes while the other half had not). I don't blame anyone but the restaurant for not realizing that perhaps one additional cook and one additional server is necessary to serve during prime time. 

That being said, the food was alright. The udon was a tad bit salty, and I have no idea why the tempura udon includes all the tempura inside of the udon itself (this makes the panko soggy and generally unpleasant to eat). I did enjoy the design rolls, however, but it was admittedly a bit pricey. 

I've never been a huge fan of the automatic tipping rule in cases like these where our fairly large party did not get proper service (we had to pay 20% tip for our $150+ order), so we probably won't be returning here with a large group.
author: David Y.

description:
We were looking for a nearby sushi place one night and Tamashisoul came up so we tried it out.  We didn't have a reservation but we were there early so we were able to be seated right away.  I'm glad we did because we had a wonderful meal.  The staff was very helpful and gave us a few suggestions on what to order.  How was HyeJi able to remember our entire order without writing it down I'm not sure but it was impressive.

We ordered the avocado bomb (so good and our kids ate it without even knowing what it was.  We also go the Tamashi on Fire (great taste and presentation), red hot chili pepper.  Everything we had was delicious.  Our kids had gyozo, edamame, avocado roll and cucumber roll and loved their meal as well.

If you're looking for a great sushi spot in the Marina, look no further than here.  We'll be back for sure.
author: Blake B.

description: Good sashimi and sushi, service could be better. Nice amount of non-fish options as well.
author: Rabia H.

description:
Tamashisoul is the the sushi bar/restaurant for the 21st century. I enjoyed this union street eatery very much. We held family dinner her and at first I was worried because as a modern eatery you worry how they are going to cater to your 70 year old Mom. However I  could not have been more wrong. The staff was amazing and the food was on point. Thank you so much you guys. You literally made our night. 

I urge you to enjoy this restaurant and all it has to offer.
author: Da B.

description: Great dumplings. The sushi is good but not as great as I thought it would be. The service was 5 star, though!!
author: Tara K.

description:
This place is great! I love all the rolls I've tried

Tamashi on fire- takes a while because it comes out hot, but really good and flavorful.

Yellow tail love- I think it was good but I personally don't love asparagus in my sushi, so I would have subbed it for cucumber or avocado.

I've definitely tried a couple more but I don't remember what they are. I will come back and update my review when I do.
author: Jenna G.

description:
Yelp, you let me down again. Either that, or it's very difficult to do delivery sushi well at all.

I got an amaebi nigiri and a chirashi. The presentation on both dishes were quite lacking. The shrimp's flesh was an almost grey-greenish color, although it tasted fine and was quite meaty. It was over a bed of cucumbers that was starting to water, as if they'd been cut for a while. The ginger and wasabi were thrown into the container haphazardly.

As for the chirashi, the fish ranged from slightly unfresh tasting (salmon) to solidly fishy (tuna). Unlike more tasty sushi spots, the fish here was also quite solid. I will credit them for giving sizeable chunks of fish though. 

Probably not going to order from here again, although the avocado bomb everyone is talking about reminds me of a delicious dish that was similar looking...so I could be back for that.
author: Nicole H.

description:
It was one of those places that I used to walk by, wondering if it was any good, and then kept going as there are SO many sushi places in SF one can't try them all, can one?

Well, I finally went it and gave it a whirl.  Service was prompt, and I ordered strictly nigiri sushi and sashimi a la carte.  Everything was excellent, the fish fresh, melting in your mouth the way it should be, and good portions. That was a five-star experience for me.

So why 4 stars?

I sat at the bar and I was a bit disappointed that a server came in to take our order, if I sit at the bar, I want to deal directly with the sushi chef except for ordering drinks. What can I say, I'm old style, maybe because I lived in Japan for a while.  But it is not a big deal. 

The second let down was that they don't have ankimo, and I always ask for ankimo appetizer, which in my mind separates the good places from the very good places (you almost never see it on the menu but if you ask for it the very good places have it).

Those two things cost Tamashisoul the fifth star.
author: Massimo M.

description: This place is to my go to for a quick and enjoyable meal.  I like to eat and explore SF solo and Tamashi never fails to please my palate.  My faves:  Avocado salad, Camacho carpaccio and sashimi.  Also, I either add a glass of sake or red wine.  Their sushi rolls are also good!  I arrived for a late night meal (around 9) and they were not crowded and the staff treated me well.
author: Hiromi N.

description: Love the food, staff are very friendly and attentive.  Wells definitely me back for date night
author: Jackie L.

description:
Aside from the special edamame, nothing was tasty to me. The beer wasn't even cold!  
Service was fine ok and I got my food fast.
author: Lucy M.

description: Ordered to-go from here the other day and it was good, but not great. Thought the Nigiri was great and the rolls were 50/50 - 3 were good and 2 were just ok. I'd like to try again as a "dine-in" customer.
author: Nicole O.

description:
Randomly walked into this Japanese restaurant/bar place after a funday in fort mason on a Saturday. It wasn't quite dinner time yet but we were hungry and happy they are open.  The place isn't fancy, but trendy and compact with a bar area and a line of table seating against the wall. 

Service was A-okay, since there was only another couple and us at the restaurant, so the wait wasn't that bad. I can see the service being slow when it does get crowded.  Also reservation at this place seems to be preferred as the parties that came after us all seemed to have reservations.  

As for the food and beverage options, they serve the ush food: sushi, sashimi, udon and appetizer dishes along with an extensive wine and beer alcohol list (no cocktails).  I went with the Tempura udon as my husband ordered the Hawaiian and Tamashisoul roll. The udon was very flavor, but it had a lot of random vegetable like carrots and bell pepper in there (not a fan).  I think my husband really liked his sushi. It looked pretty but I didn't try it.  

It's a good place to stop for a quick bite to eat, but not a place I would go to really satisfy the sushi craving.
author: Young N.

description: Food here was amazing. The sashimi combo was a good combination of each type of fish. It was all super buttery and delicious. You can definitely tell how fresh it is. I had the Tashami on fire roll and it was delicious.. they really lit the roll on fire in front of you. Omg but you like udon get the seafood udon noodle soup. I usually love ramen more but this is by far the best udon noodle I have tried to far. I will have to come back when I'm in the area. The special edamame was good too as a starter BC it's full of flavor. Get that to munch on while you sip on that sake or beer.
author: Jennifer V.

description: My husband and I ordered the Uni Nigiri, Sashimi Combo, Rainbow roll, and Sweet Scallop roll. I'd give the quality of the fish a five star, very taster and fresh! However we found bits of Uni shells in the nigiri. Also the scallop roll was poorly wrapped as it was falling apart, delicious though! The restaurant gets really loud FYI.
author: Amanda K.

description: The servers were nice so I don't like giving 2 stars but the acoustics were awful and it was very loud despite not having a lot of people. My sashimi was slightly fishy and the uni was so so. They only have sale and wine and only mochi for ice cream. The ponzu sauce was cheap - not very good. Had one roll I really liked and one that was so so.
author: Shannon D.

description:
Excellent service.
Excellent sushi rolls.
Didn't try the Sashimi but will do next time i al back. 
The atmosphere is casual, came here on  Sunday night with a girlfriend.
author: Mary N.

description:
Three and a half stars for this place! The service was good but the tables were a little cramped. We were basically eating dinner with the couple next to us lol I like the diversity of their menu (we love when sushi places have specialty items). We started with the Avocado Bomb from the specialty items, it was amazing! I highly recommend this. For rolls, we had the Red Hot Snapper, the Red Hot Chili Pepper, and the Las Vegas. All the rolls were good but not great! We were also a little disappointed with how little they were.

Overall good, not incredible though
author: Julia M.

description:
I was taken here on a first date with my boyfriend and it now has become one of our favorite spots. Always enjoy the great service and the special attention. 

I am gluten free and sometimes sushi places are limited, but I always love the accommodations they make for me! Our go toos are the rainbow roll (with fresh crab) and the fresh sashimi platter, but you really cannot go wrong with what you order.
author: Becky P.

description: Good sushi, the special rolls that are flamed we're pretty good, would have like to try others that were not in foil for a try!
author: Keisha M.

description:
Must try the Rib Eye Yakisoba. The cut of meat was soft and delicious, and the flavor of the noodles was rich. I also recommend the Design rolls, like the Tamashi on Fire . Served in aluminum foil and set ablaze in front of you, this was an experience with a delicious ending! 

Unfortunately the service was a little slow. I was struggling to stay focused on the conversation as my stomach started digesting itself . One of our guests had her soup go cold waiting to everyone else to be served.  But if you can handle the wait, it's really quite good.
author: Camille B.

description:
Great little sushi spot in a convenient and fun location. Excellent atmosphere, only amplified by the lovely customer service. Grab a seat at the bar for fun conversations and enjoy watching the chefs work their magic. 

Favorite dishes--special edamame (with a soy and garlic glaze, can't get enough), avocado bomb, bamboo roll! Generous wine pour as well :) great for a night with friends, a date, parents in town, you name it!
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
This sushi place is INCREDIBLE. My girlfriend and I came for a Sunday lunch, around 1PM or so and we sat immediately at the bar. Hot sake, and two large Sapporo's were ordered and came immediately. The bartender (our server) was extremely attentive.

We ordered four rolls total: the avocado bomb and the spicy red snapper are the only two who's name I can remember. What really stood out about this establishment was how impressively FRESH the fish was! It was quite obvious it was recently caught. The rolls aren't overpowered with unnecessary sauces or ingredients. Just simple, fresh, bite-size deliciousness. 

I wish I could come here more often, but being that I was only visiting SanFran I can't! Next time I'm in town, I'll certainly be back. I would recommend it to everyone.
author: Kyle J.

description:
Atmosphere:
Casual. Dark and intimate decor

Interior:
Open seating 
Bar available.
Clean restrooms.

Service:
Adequate, greeted us upon arrival. 
However, the woman behind the counter recommended a roll that my friend couldn't eat due to a severe gluten after the allergy was mentioned to her. Once the roll came and we informed her my friend couldn't eat it after taking a bite and removing it from her mouth with a napkin back on the plate. The women gave us a blank stare and didn't apologize and was going to make us pay for it, until we asked if she can toss it out for us. I feel like this could've been handled a bit better. 

Food:
Menu has a lot of options. 

Garlic edamame is to die for :)
double shrimp roll is excellent

Cons:
It's a little pricey (as are other sushi restaurants)

Overall:
good sushi
Pricey

I may return
author: Nicky V.

description:
I'm not a fan. I actually would prefer to give them a 1.5 star, or even a 1 star, but I really hope they actually have some other nicer servers. Food is fine. Prices meh. 

I saw on yelp that this restaurant had good ratings, so I decided to take my sister and my 3yo niece there. Parking in that area is terrible. half the streets were blocked off because of construction, so the parking availabilities were effectively halved. So I had to park in the neighborhood, but I only got that bright idea after 25 minutes of circling. (Don't worry, I didn't rate them on parking- this is just a warning to anyone with a car.)

When I finally came running into the restaurant, my sister had already ordered food for her daughter, and the little one was eating it (good.) I barely have sat down and addressed my sister when the waitress comes over and demands "are you ready to order". I literally look at her and deadpan "I just sat down, I'll need a moment." Seriously, this woman- it wasn't like I was socializing for the last twenty minutes and wasted her time here. I JUST sat down, I didn't even completely take off my jacket, and I was still catching my breath from running in! 

I look at the menu, and prices aren't exactly the best here, so I only ordered the spider roll, my sister got some hamachi appetizer and another roll, and the little one had a tempura roll and ankimo. I'm very glad my sister ordered for my niece before I came, because it took another twenty to thirty minutes for our food to come out. We were one of three parties in the restaurant at that moment, and no one had extremely huge orders. I have no idea what took them so long. 

Spider roll: pretty crispy crab, but drenched in sauce. Would have preferred less sauce.
Hamachi appetizer: Really good, fresh fish. Too much sauce, but it was easy to remove. 

In conclusion: Won't come here again, didn't feel welcome. Our waitress was really forceful whenever she asked us "IS EVERYTHING OKAY HERE" as if she was daring us to say otherwise. Food was decent, but not quite worth the price tag. 

~~~

EDIT:: 
About two days later, my sister had to go back to pick up our forgotten toddler utensils. I'm very glad and grateful that they kept it for us, because apparently my sister had to beg them to hold it because they were going to throw it away? (what the?), and when my sister retrieved them, her fabric bag that stored the utensils was soaking wet. (Ew! I hope it was water...) 

I then took this opportunity to talk to my sister about the service. I felt like that waitress was weirdly cold and not hospitable. Apparently before I came in, the waitress took my sister's order incorrectly, and then blamed it on my niece. Not cool. My sister pointed at and SAID "tempura roll", and the waitress brought her a tempura appetizer. Not a huge difference, and easily fixable. but nope- the waitress took it to the cook, and said loudly "They ordered the appetizer, but the baby hanged her mind." Excuse me- my niece is one to stubbornly stick to what she wants (Trust us- we would prefer she just eat the tempura appetizer). AND my sister would never allow her to inconvenience others with her fickleness. The cook was nice though- and just said to my sister "it's okay, I have kids, I understand." Sweet sentiment, but nope, you just have a very inept waitress. 


I think they have the potential to be a really nice good neighborhood restaurant, but the way that waitress treated us really left a bitter taste in our mouths. I'd rather go somewhere I don't feel some waitress' misdirected vengeance.
author: Tiffany W.

description: One of the best sushi places I've been to in the Bay. True Japanese owned and run sushi spot.
author: Charles K.

description: Quick lunch today here. Place was empty but not because of the food quality. Ala carte lunch for two of Sushi and Sashimi with toro was $140 including soup and salad. Good quality, fast and attentive service. One star off for price.
author: Chris B.

description: Book a reservation the night in advance if you plan to go after 5 p.m. In a nice area of town and serves fresh and tasty sushi. We like the more "fun" rolls with unique mixes of things and sauces. This is great for the adventurous sushi lovers and classic sushi lovers alike.
author: Sara R.

description:
It's okay to splurge on food occasionally -- go out for a round for a drinks, pamper yourself by taking a stroll along Union St and seeing all the boutiques a few blocks can offer you. But make sure you go to Tamashi at least once when you're in the area. 

The staff is super friendly and attentive -- there seems to be mixed reviews all over the place in terms of fish quality and wait staff service, but I was never disappointed during the times I have been here, weekdays and weekends.

The sashimi was on point. And the sushi rice had just the right amount of vinegar added to it giving a tangy kick. 

Not your traditional sushi joint, although they do make those options available for their guests. But what they are really known for are there sushi rolls! 

I can tell the sushi chefs really care about presentation -- every garnish is placed with thought and care, which makes the Tamashi-experience a fun and delicious one.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: The spicy miso soup is amazing. This sushi place is just very costly, however I do always enjoy myself.
author: Tina L.

description:
Very low expectations for sushi in the Marina. I live a few blocks down and have been here once before but went again last night. Would not recommend the sashimi platter. Cuts did not taste fresh and would even say they tasted rather fishy. I did like their shrimp tempura hand roll, however, and service was good. 

Sat next to an interesting couple who I had to assume was on their first date based off their conversation. Poor girl had to have dinner with a guy who was cussing the whole time, on his phone texting, and overall just seemed sleezy. Found that rather entertaining though. ;)
author: Zara H.

description:
I loved our waiter, he was adorable. The pace was good throughout the night regarding the service. The ambience was intimate and calm seated at the table and lively at the bar.

We orded calamari which was delicious (highly recommend), rainbow roll, Las Vegas roll and a crab roll I think. Spilt between two people it was a good size. Everything was fresh, and the texture was amazing!

So good! Be prepared to spend a little though. I would return for a light meal in the future. It was within walking distance to the pier and the Ghirardelli store. We found parking close on the street for free.
author: Lara G.

description:
{From the kid}: I came here with my dad earlier today and he and the owner had a good talk. Otherwise, I really liked the avocado rolls+ the catsu chicken with the rice.
I really had a great time there and I loved the interior with the bamboo on the walls+ the lighting is great. Thanks again for the beautiful service and for letting us stay after the closing hours.
author: Stephane M.

description: They have really good appetizers.  Their rolls were ok, but this is not a great place for sashimi or nigiri as they do not the greatest quality fish.  I'm more into sashimi, so its a 3-star for me.  If you're more into rolls, then I could see this as a 4 star.
author: Andrew H.

description: The service was fairly quick on a Monday night. The food was fresh, but a lot (mostly) of it was raw. We ordered the omakase and some rolls. We'll be back to try the others soon, since Japanese is his fave.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Came to San Fran for the weekend for my girlfriends birthday...on our final night we were looking for a sushi spot (after a -not so great- experience the day prior at a sushi spot downtown) and decided on Tamashisoul...

I recommend making a reservation...we walked in on a Saturday night and it was full...though I didn't have a reservation, the staff was very accommodating and I was seated shortly after...

the waiter was the full package: cordial, informative, attentive and funny...he made a few  recommendations and I decided on one (the Bamboo roll)...along with the Philly roll and salmon sashimi, it was all fantastic...even had my favorite beer (Peroni) $4 draft... in a city where most restaurants come with a hefty tab, Tamashi was extremely reasonable for the amount of food we had, especially for a lovely looking restaurant...this is a for sure, go to, spot anytime I am in town...
author: Gianni A.

description: Sushi was fresh and we enjoyed our meal. Service was good as well  - attentive and helpful.
author: Babs J.

description:
Quaint little sushi place on the busy streets in the Marina. I came here after a dance workout and was ravenously craving sushi for lunch. This was the only sushi place open within a 15 mile radius! Everywhere else opened at 5 for dinner D: My expectations weren't too high but I was pleasantly surprised at how affordable all the rolls were considering it is the Marina where overpriced food and luxury goods invade. Just a few blocks away a huge crowd of yuppies came out of Soul Cycle so I was expecting small portions and large prices. However each roll was only $10-15 and the portions were very filling.  

The decor and ambiance was quite dark for a place that opens at 11 am, but the staff was incredibly inviting and gave the best recommendations. I ended up deciding on the King Salmon roll which was baked salmon and raw with cream cheese which is my absolute favorite. The rolls come in 8 pieces and I was debating about getting a second but the first one truly hit the spot. Sauce was tasty but not overwhelming and salmon was fresh as can be. I will definitely be coming back whenever I'm in the area!
author: Lisa H.

description: Used to live close, and it was our every Friday night, sit at the sushi bar type place. Now we can't go as often, but still will drive a few miles to get here rather than the closer sushi places. Get the King Salmon roll... worth it.
author: Lauren V.

description: Is anyone else really annoyed of how the menu is formatted on the website? I'm trying to write a review so I can remember what I ordered but the menu on the website is really impractical! LOL. Don't worry, I'm not writing a review based on that though!!! This place was pretty good. It wasn't too busy when my family and I ate here, so I can't really say much about this place being understaffed. The service here was really great and it's has a pretty quiet atmosphere. We got the Torched Salmon, Avocado Bomb, Kamikaze and Tamashi on Fire. I've seen the fiery sushi concept before and love the concept of it, and the roll was delicious. Their sushi rolls are pretty good here but is rather expensive. The very much ranted Avocado Bomb was alright. I personally didn't find anything too special about it for the price I had to pay.
author: Kaye T.

description:
Ok so. This is clearly a good date spot but I think it's reeeaaaally fun (with or without a date) to sit at the bar here. It's more lively and you can people watch and talk to the bartenders. Issac is the BEST - he's super upbeat, attentive, and always makes awesome recommendations, despite my fussy requests to customize everything on the menu. 

Oh and the food! Right. I haven't liked any sushi in the city but the menu here is sooooo good and the freshness is completely unparalleled (ok, I haven't been to alllll the sushi places in SF, but you get it).

Serious Recommendations: 
- Hamachi Carpaccio
- Tuna Carpaccio 

Less Serious Recommendations:
- Red Snapper Tataki
- Red Hot Chili Pepper

Enjoy! :)
author: Becca S.

description:
Great food and awesome service! All the plates we ordered were excellent:
- Spicy Tuna Tar Tar
- King Salmon
- Tamashi On Fire

Also I forgot my credit card at the restaurant, and the staff called me immediately after they noticed. I really appreciate their honesty.

A great restaurant all in all!
author: L N.

description: Would not recommend this restaurant. It wasn't horrible, but there are several better sushi restaurants within 10 minutes of this one that are better. There are a couple rolls I've had at this place that were decent (spicy tuna roll and the yellow tail love roll) but the rolls where the cut of fish was the main feature (rainbow roll, alaska roll, etc.) all tasted extremely fishy and several cuts of fish had skin all over.
author: Sydney N.

description: We were very disappointed here. Based on the reviews we thought the sushi will be authentic. Everything we ordered was swimming in sauce and too sweet. The avocado bomb, the noodles and chicken teriyaki. The unagi ball was the same. We were 5 people and they charged us 20% gratuity plus 3.5% SF service on top of taxes and there was no mention of that on the menu.
author: Sharon S.

description: This is a mayonnaise restaurant. Couldn't even taste the fish because there was way too much mayo (even on what the waiter described as a "light" roll). I'm a no-sushi-left-behind kind of person, but I couldn't even finish my meal.
author: Rachel K.

description: Service was incredible! Sushi was so fresh and absolutely delicious. We had the rainbow roll,  white angel and Hawaiian roll with yakisoba. All the food was excellent. Sushi had very little rice, like its supposed to be, so you taste the fish not the rice. Highly recommend!!
author: Tim J.

description: Very disappointed in the customer service at this restaurant. Ordered the sashimi platter and was met with 12 pieces of very small, thin cut fish. Shocked as this amount of fish could have easily been in a sashimi salad or a roll. I told my server who got the manager and told me he would tell the chef. No offer to bring out any other fish or roll but they did take 20% off. I had to order another roll in order to feel satiated, spending over $40 (after they auto added tip DESPITE poor customer service) for the most mediocre fish and incredibly small portion (in the roll as well). Very sad
author: Amay G.

description:
Tamashisoul is my FAVORITE sushi spot in SF. My bf and I go there probably once a week, maybe even twice a week sometimes and it's the just best. Try the special edamame, bang bang shrimp and bamboo roll.... so good!! 
Isaac always takes care of us and has a big smile every time we go in. Love the friendly vibe of the place. 
Also a great spot to bring out of towners!
author: Meg R.

description: This places has excellent sushi. I usually come here for lunch. Service is great and you can be in an out in 45 minutes during lunch. Their special rolls are unique and flavorful. Try all of them! You won't be disappointed!
author: Subhi B.

description:
Fantastic variety, flavor, presentation, service, and drinks!! My fiancé and I took advantage of our check in deal and each ordered a Japanese liqueur. I forgot the names but they were the 20% and 24% ones...haha. The 20% one was "like water" as our server described it. Very impressive considering the high alcohol percentage.

We loved our tuna tartare - it was presented beautifully and tasted just as good.

We also go the red snapper and spider rolls - highly recommend both. The red snapper roll is cooked in aluminum for a quick sec before you eat it, which is pretty entertaining.

Definitely check this place out (:
author: Mio W.

description: This place is fantastic. Extremely good sushi, get the Bamboo roll, it is perfect. If you choose to be unpretentious, you'll love it here.
author: Stefani C.

description: Great atmosphere, very trendy, good proices bit small sushi sizes. Pretty big spot for a sushi joint in SF. Service was friendly, just getting reservations is a pain because they put you on hold for 10mins!!!! Wth!!! But im happy the service was friendly or i was gonna give them 3 stars.
author: Varsenig K.

description:
I recently tried this place for the first time with my brother, but it is definitely now our favorite and go-to sushi place.

I had a good feeling about the restaurant even before my first bite. The restaurant's interior is simple yet seek, with a very attentive service. We were recommended to order the special chirashi bowl (1st picture) and the omakase sushi combination (2nd picture), and it was by far the best one we've ever had. They were incredibly fresh and tasty with the perfect amount of sauce to match the flavors. Since it includes a variety of different fishes, we were able to enjoy every piece- we loved it! Also, Isaac was one of the sweetest staff, answering every little question we had with his brightest smile that warmed our heart. They all remembered to always refill our water and made sure to check in with us if everything was okay. This place totally has it all, with reasonable prices, high quality fish, and amazing service.

Overall, we had such a perfect experience and this place definitely deserves a 5-star recommendation! We will be back soon for sure.
author: Rina T.

description: I came here for my masters graduation dinner and the food was SO DELICIOUS! We started with some rolls -- loved the unique Hawaiian roll wrapped in cucumber, yum -- and then I had the Crazy Love and vegetable tempura. The fish was very fresh, beautifully plated, and paired perfectly. Everyone loved their food. The sushi rice bowl looked amazing. We also had tempura ice cream for dessert -- YUM! I could live off that food forever. So happy I came here! Hope to return soon! Also the wait staff was very nice and fast!! Much  to Tamashisoul!
author: Maya S.

description:
So after living 2 blocks away for a year, we finally gave in on a tired/lazy night to try this place out. Now to be fair, my wife and I have lived in Japan for about 30 years combined, so we know how to appreciate good sushi. And just to be clear, this does not mean we expect what you get at a $600 a person place like Urasawa in LA or Masa in NY.

But we do expect fresh seafood. Would you go to a grocery store to purchase fruits past their prime, on the brink of rotting and having an almost intolerable level of funk? I hope not.

This is what we got in the two seafood dishes we ordered. The chirashi, which is an assortment of sashimi slices in a bowl of sushi rice, and the rainbow row. All fish in both dishes, except the tuna and salmon were inedible. The tuna and salmon were just edible, not enjoyable. The chirashi actually had  slices of tuna "marinated" in soy. When this was explained I immediately suspected it was a technique to extend the expiration date of the fish. It certainly did not enhance the tuna but even more oddly, the marinated fish was actually quite dry. In fact, all the fish was drier than what I'm used to, probably due to the length of time it has spent in their refrigerator after being thawed (yes, almost all sushi grade fish is flash frozen) but the marinated tuna was the most dry. Remembering the meal, there were actually thinner slices of fish that were starting to stiffen into shape. Ya, picture that.

So if you love rolls filled with imitation crab or spicy tuna and something deep fried in or on top your roll, this is your place. Convenient location and decent prices. 

If you expect fresh fish and want to taste it rather than the sauces, fried gimmicks, cream cheese, etc., do not go here. We eat out several nights a week and this was the worst meal I've had in 3-4 years. I almost felt angry I put food like this in my stomach. I feel horrible for saying this but it's true and so unfortunate because theres only a handful of sushi options in this neighborhood. Now, they are of course catering to the local market but I almost see it as if they are taking advantage of their customers who don't know better. Either way, if you want sushi/sashimi, I think this review gives you an idea of who their target market is. Choose based on this.

The edamame was the best dish. We also tried the smoked squid salad which had a deceiving description. I would be surprised if they actually smoked the squid themselves. This is a typical style of preserving squid in Korea that you can buy in batches from Korean markets. If it is made on premise, than it certainly doesn't taste like it was made fresh. Sorry Tamashisoul, this is just my honest observations from our meal 30 minutes ago. Nothing personal. One last criticism, you don't have a sushi bar so don't ask customers if they want to sit there. You only have a bar...
author: Wes P.

description:
Just a year ago, I lived around the corner and would frequent this place as it was good for price and the area. Moving away has made this location a bit out of the way, however, last weekend I came to the area to get a haircut and knew it was perfect opportunity to come and have dinner like the "good ole times."

I would say the best times to come in and eat are around the 4:00 or 5:00pm time slots as it usually isn't crowded. In fact, when I walked in it was completely empty, maybe a couple of customers at the bar. Since it was me, I decided to take a seat at the bar. The bartender, although cordial, seemed to have a particular way of serving; almost as if he was a bit flustered the entire time. I would ask him for something seemingly simple like a glass of water and he would say "hold on, I'll be right back," come back and have to ask me again about what I needed...which was a water. It wasn't off putting and he was serving the entire restaurant (later, more people came in and sat on tables), so not a complete big deal; as a former server, I thought that was interesting though. What I love about the place, though is the decor. It's intimate and a perfect spot for date night! Table tops, high tops and bar seating offers lots of room for diners. Big screen tv's serve as a nice touch as well. 

Throughout my many visits, I've gotten a few things, but on this particular visit, here's what I ordered: 

-Sake Clam Soup for $6.00. OMG, I've never had a soup like this. You can taste the sweetness from the sake and deep right clam broth. LOTS of clams fill the bowl. HIGHLY RECOMMEND, if you like clams. 

-Nigiris range from $5.00-$7.00, depending on what you get. I usually get an order (comes with 2 pieces) of sake or salmon and tako or octopus. The fish was fresh and their wasabi is homemade so that's a beautiful touch! 

-Wasabi Shumai for $6.00. It's your classic pork dumpling with a hint of fresh wasabi served in a little broth (maybe ponzu?). Soooo good. I love how this place takes your classic dishes and adds one, maybe two ingredients to really enhance the overall experience. This was no difference. 

-Bamboo roll for $10.00: Spicy salmon topped with avocado, crunch, soy tobiko, scallion and special sauce. This was a big roll and super good. They put a ton of tobiko on the top which added more flavor to it. No need for soy sauce on this, lots of flavors going on already. 

Overall, my experience at Tamashisoul has always been good. I consider this place great for the location and completely reasonable in price. If you're in the area, come check them out!
author: Rockne H.

description:
Walked in to be greeted by the three sushi pimps behind the counter, me and my girl made 5 people total in the house. 2 of those 5 would experience the best sushi of their lives. The other 3 would become legends. 

Yellowtail classic roll. Spicy tuna classic roll. Red snapper nigiri. Salmon nigiri and smoked salmon nigiri. All of this was so fresh I felt like Bear Grylls pulling a salmon out of the river and tearing it open with my teeth. 

So fresh and so clean clean
author: Red E.

description: This place is pretty good. I wanted to get some sushi to go for a party, so I picked from the "classic" sushi list. I ordered the Boston, Alaska, California, Spicy Tuna, and Shrimp Tempura rolls. They came with six pieces since it was Happy Hour time. I spent $27 on all of that, and got a Coke on top of that.
author: Denise C.

description:
I've got to disagree with most reviews here lately, and say that this place flat out sucked...
Cold Miso soup, followed by largely over cooked and mushy edamame, with a crescendo of a sashimi combo that literally had ZERO taste. 
I would recommend going somewhere else.
author: Mike P.

description: If you want great sushi and even better service this is the spot. Sit at the bar and Issac will take care of the rest. Order the tamachi on fire and you won't be disappointed. Also the jams they play are all fire emoji
author: Vince E.

description:
Tamashisoul, you've blown me away!

Here's the deal: 

In no way, shape or form did I walk in here today thinking it would be one of the best sushi experiences in a very long time- but it definitely was. These guys know how to make some mean sushi! The presentation is stunning, the service here is awesome and the sushi is down right incredible. The proportion size of the rolls themselves are misleading at first sight. They look smaller than your typical sushi rolls, but don't let that fool you. I was completely full from two orders of their specialty rolls: The Bamboo Roll (spicy salmon topped with avocado, crunch, soy tobiko, scallion and their special sauce) and The White Angel Roll (spicy tuna and asparagus topped with white tuna and their special sauce). The spicy miso soup is also a unique and welcome dish; simple, yet rich in flavor. 

Other than the incredible food here, the service is very friendly and quick. I waited no more than 10 minutes for my food, and was back to work in 30 minutes total. It's the perfect place for lunch, and makes for a great dinner as well. When it comes to first impressions, they've aced the test. I can really only say that parking is tough to find (unless you live/work in the area), but it's worth looking an extra 10 minutes.

Final verdict: You like sushi right? If you said yes, make your way over here as soon as possible for a delicious meal. If you said no, this is still the perfect place to start. Fresh sushi, tasty and made with passion. Basically, if you can't tell by my enthusiasm for this great spot: you need to try it at least once.
author: Alex B.

description: Sushi is mediocre at best. I mean with no reservation at 730PM, you could be waiting for 90 minutes. Ah no, bye Felicia.
author: Vinson H.

description:
Tamashisoul is missing exactly that, it's soul.

Located in the heart of the Marina, this place already has a reputation before even entering the establishment. Whether that is a good or bad thing I'll leave up to you to decide. The cold and dark interior can't help but feel like it's missing something - perhaps authenticity? It's perfect for the Marina crowd with their eyes constantly on another prize, but perhaps for sushi aficionados they could have brought in some more Japanese influence.

Don't get me wrong, the food is good - but I wouldn't call it great, especially for the price. Tamashisoul has the perfect amount of white-washing mixed into each dish so you don't have to worry about eating actual sushi. Fried here and charred there, you can get whatever your heart desires. Extra sauce? They've got that too.
author: Kevin J.

description: Best sushi in town. The staff are really nice as well. The sushi chef is an artist. We've never had baby baracuda before but it's so tasty.  They get fish from Japan as well as locally. Everything tasted really fresh. Can't wait to come back. Best restaurant on Union street!
author: Cindy W.

description: Stumbled upon this restaurant and was pleasantly surprised. Great prices, good udon, good sushi, and very great service! Will come again!
author: Alexandria D.

description: Amazing sushi spot! Dropped in for happy hour with my boo and we had delicious standard rolls, more exciting rolls (white sake tempura and red hot snapper), and the most delicious sashimi (red snapper and tuna). Our waiter was amazing and gave us incredible recs. Highly recommended!
author: Megan C.

description: I came here with a friend tonight after yoga (sopping wet from sweat) and it was very busy! I ordered the seaweed salad, tobiko island specialty roll, two-piece order of yellowtail sashimi and two-piece order of eel sashimi; my friend also ordered two specialty rolls as well. The seaweed salad was tasty but as I love seaweed salad I thought the portion was too small to split so I would go with this as a serving for one person. The specialty rolls were all good and I thought the quality of the fish in both the rolls and sashimi was tasty as well. Their specialty rolls aren't overly large and I definitely could have split another specialty roll. All in all I think average sushi spot that I would be back to in the neighborhood.
author: Aryn C.

description:
Mmmm...I'd come back but only because the Sweet Scallop roll gave me such a good first impression that I'm curious about their other rolls. It's sweet and had a hint of spice. I can do without the Red Hot Snapper roll though, even with the super cool presentation - it comes wrapped in foil and they light it on fire. The waiter says they were trying to do something cool but it seems it didn't work. The breaded tuna was way too salty for me.

So I noticed that they had walu on one or two of their rolls but they didn't have it as just sushi or sashimi. I asked the nice waitress and she may have been new but she said the walu is actually the white tuna. To my knowledge, not so much but whatever, not that big of a deal. Just letting you know so you don't have to ask if they just have walu sushi or sashimi. Should've went for the uni instead...
author: Athena C.

description: Great sushi place; very fresh and priced great. We made a reservation and sat down right away. Highly recommend coming here, you won't regret it!
author: Molly O.

description:
BYOS (bring your own service)

Good sushi, bad service. Not enough servers. This has happened the past two times. Stay away if you value service.
author: Adam O.

description:
Came here with my bf and loved this place. We came here after work so it was kind of later in the night and it's located on union street. We drove here and there were lots of parking which was great!! The girl that served us was so sweet and the man that was there was so wonderful too. He kept checking on us and made sure we were good. 

The bummer part was that they charged for green tea. I feel like they shouldn't charge anyone, i MEAN IT IS a japanese restaurant after all... but we got the avocado bomb, red hot snapper, bamboo, tamashi on fire, and vanilla tempera ice cream. 

I have to say that the two rolls on fire were pretty interesting to watch.
Bambo was covered in a sweet and sour sauce which, I liked a lot but my bf didn't.  

The best thing and MUST get is the tempera ice cream. I'm usually not a huge fan of tempera ice cream but woah this was dry good! I absolutely loved ice cream! It tasted amazing!! The flour was perfect and it was huge!!! 

The two roles were pretty much had been topped with mayo and some dot of hot sauce. Wasn't too impressed. 

Service A+ 
Fish very fresh A
The method of the sushi was mediocre so I give it a B.
author: Amy Y.

description: One of my favorite sushi bar on union street. Great food, lovely atmosphere and amazing service.
author: Aykut G.

description:
Oooooooh!  I'm a fan!  This place is young and fun, yet still sophisticated and artful.  

There is a love and care to the food produced here and I found the quality of the food especially good for the price.  

My Uni Nigiri ($8) was amazing quality.  It held together as a nigiri without a "wall-o-seaweed" to hold it in place.  The orange uni was very good and fresh with a little black caviar on top which really made it special.  

The happy hour included $5 special edamame, $5 beef gyoza, $5 house-warm sake, and $5 classic rolls.  

I had the Alaska Roll and the Spicy Tuna Roll.  I loved that there was not a ton of rice on the sushi.  I normally end up removing rice because there is too much.  The fish was very fresh and presented beautifully.   

I also ordered a miso soup ($3) which I thought had great flavor and was a pretty good portion (not a super tiny bowl).  

Mr. Man got the beef gyoza which were lovely and fried.  I liked the beefy flavor over the traditional pork.  While the gyoza was a bit oily for my taste, I can't really complain because it was super tasty and crispy.  Mr. Man loved it and gobbled it down in seconds.

Service was probably one of the most excellent parts of our experience.  We sat at the bar (it was not too busy) and Jeffery and Ryan really took great care of us.  Most notably, Mr. Man has allergies to all seafood and they were really accommodating about finding things that he could eat next time we come for a full meal.  It is rare that Mr. Man a) likes a sushi place due to his allergies; b) likes anywhere without a full bar; c) would voluntarily ask if we could come back to a sushi place without a full bar soon.  Tamashisoul Sushi really charmed him, and that is a tall order.

I'm a huge fan of this place!  Any sushi place that makes both of us happy is a definite winner to me!
author: Susan C.

description: SO yummy and delicious fried shrimp appetizer. We ended up ordering a second order. The service was top notch.
author: Megab N.

description: Love this place! Delicious, super fresh and at such an affordable price...yes, I said affordable. The fire roll is a revelation. It's bought to the table wrapped in foil, the waiter gently doses the edges with a small flame and when it's unwrapped it's like Christmas came early...a exceptional smokey essence that is unique and down right tasty. Bottom line...you'll love this spot..trust!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Walked into this spot with some of the boys on a Saturday night, I was having a rough day that day, and I wanted to fill the void with sushi, sake, and beer. The interior was modern and has a pretty cool feel to it. My friends and I sat at the bar and our bartender/server named Isaac helped us pick what we would eat and drink for the night. 

Food:

I'm a sushi snob period, I grew up with an uncle who owned a sushi restaurant so I was exposed to sushi at an early age. My taste and palate as you would define would be refined at this point in my life. We ordered the sashimi platter, tamashi on fire special roll, shrimp tempura, sweet scallop roll, and a bamboo roll. The sashimi was fresh and huge, the special rolls were amazing, I especially enjoyed the sweet scallop roll. We paired our food with a large Sapporo to start and then our server Isaac asked if we wanted to try Japanese tequila, it tasted very similar to sake but it was light and smooth as most sakes are. 

Service:

Isaac was an attentive server/bartender, he recommended some awesome rolls and alcohol. He was upbeat and fast. 

Location:

Unless your a local, finding parking around the can be arduous.
author: Qumvithea L.

description:
Walked in here after watching the Warriors game next door and surprised at how good the sushi is! Everything we ordered was great and especially loved the smoky flavor of the red hot snapper and spicy tuna tar tar. 

I do agree with the other reviews that service is slow and glasses were dirty that we asked for new ones.
author: Yvonne L.

description: This place is AMAZING!! My boyfriend and I came here for my birthday and I'm so glad we did. The sushi was to die for and the service was phenomenal! Our waiter was so much fun and he really took the time to give us his recommendations. I had the double shrimp roll and my boyfriend had the bamboo roll and salmon sashimi with bang bang shrimp as an appetizer. Everyone that works here is very accommodating and super nice. Bottom line, definitely check this place out, you won't regret it!!
author: Brea D.

description:
Good sushi spot! I always pass it by but finally tried it last night with a few friends.

Special edamame - quite tasty elevation of normal edamame with some garlic-y concoction on it
Special rolls - I got the Tamishibow which was neat because you don't often see lobster salad with fish and of course avocado. Very tasty and special saucy! Friends got the Tamashi on Fire and Bamboo, both enjoyed!
Miso soup - classic miso soup is good but they also have a mushroom miso for a few more dollars for lots of mushrooms and a bigger bowl!
author: MaryKate M.

description: New favorite sushi bar! Everything is really tasty and well priced. The interior also has a nice ambience.
author: Brittany A.

description: My wife hates rice, so when I'm visiting my son in San Francisco, this place is the only place I want to eat. We always sit at the bar and have come to expect polite service, (sometimes can be a little slow) and some of the freshest fish. I understand this isn't a classic Japanese place, but that is why I like it. Korean flare, from the Avocado Bomb, to the Chef choice nigiri. My new favorite is the tomashibow.
author: Bob B.

description: We had a terrible experience here.  They don't have enough employees to serve dinner in a reasonable time and handle what appears to be a big load of Postmates/ubereats. Everyone else got their food but we waited for 90 minutes and nothing.
author: Robert M.

description: This place ran out of all the ingredients before way before their closing time, we drove very far to get here, very unpleased that they were basically still open and weren't accepting anymore customers. Whats the point of being open. Very Trash
author: Joey S.

description:
Very good sushi joint in cow hollow. 
I have been here multiple times and tried the following rolls/dishes:
-Rainbow
-Spider
-Red hot chili pepper (great, but a little small)
-California Classic 
-Spicy tuna classic
-Special edamame (fried in soy sauce, garlic, and maybe a little ginger)
-Draft beer


The sushi has always been fresh, reasonably priced, and flavorful. 

I am knocking off a star because of the terrible to-go service. I came in at 7pm on a weeknight to order one roll and special edamame. I have made sushi before and I'm fully aware that it only takes about 30 seconds to roll a roll. The edamame only needs 5 or 10 minutes to fry. So, why did it take OVER 45 minutes to get my to-go order? With no explanation or apology for the wait, I left a not happy camper and a bad taste in my mouth about the service here.
author: Amanda R.

description:
A friend of mine works here and we came here for dinner on a Tuesday night. I'm pretty skeptical of sushi places in the Marina... well, because, gimicky, expensive, and not authentic. What can I say? I am a major sushi snob.

I was pleasantly surprised by Tamashisoul. The quality of the fish was very good and they had a good variety. I even liked the fusion-y appetizer (we got the torched salmon) and roll (we got the Tamashibow). The best was the uni nigiri with quail egg. The amaebi looked really good, even though I couldn't have a piece (there was only one left). The toro was okay, but the piece was huge. And bonus points for having yuzu on hand!

There's also a good selection of sake, at good price points, so definitely get some!
author: Sherry L.

description: Was there with my family in town this weekend and it was very disappointing. Like what other reviewers say, this place smells funky, and the tables are sticky. There was only one waitress during the lunch time, who never smiled once or cared. We had 4 ppl and a baby in a stroller and they still put a 20% service charge to our bill (and they just took our change too?). The food is mediocre - tiny portion, definitely over priced for what you get. Not coming back.
author: Jenny L.

description: Generous portion of Hamachi Kama.  Nice tasting Garlic Edamame.  Bang Bang Shrimp was fast and fried just right.  Nigiri sushi could use a bit more skill improvement as it breaks down too easily.  The cucumber salmon roll was cool and inventive.  Tempura udon was good for the kids.
author: Paul S.

description: I am obsessed with all of their food. The soy sauce edamame is a must. I personally love the cream cheese and fried rolls. You can easily make a reservation last minute or just walk in. Atmosphere is great and doesnt feel too cramped.
author: Jenna G.

description: Came here last night before a show. Literally 5min into ordering food, the place packed up. Friendly host and waiters. We set by the bar and were able to watch the All Stars 3 point contest while eating some flame torched mussels, calamari salad, hamachi carpaccio, sashimi combo plate, Uni, Rainbow Roll, and a bottle of Dassai sake. Superb!
author: Vee V.

description: Love this sushi place! There fish is so fresh and their special edamame is fantastic! Unfortunate they don't have hard alcohol any more.
author: Caitlin M.

description: Normally like this place, so I figured I would get it delivered since it was a rainy day. Well, I just got my sushi and was about to take a bite when I found a hair sticking out of the side of the piece. Picture included. Needless to say, appetite went away after that. Very disappointed and will probably be staying away for a while.
author: Sherry T.

description: My girl friend and I stumbled upon this place on our vacation. We have been in SF for five days and everyday we had a talk about sushi, but decided that on our last day here we grab some place to have some. As our last day being here, we decided that we'd treat ourselves. From the photos, it seemed that it could be a decent place (pictures can be deceiving). We took a Lyft ride from downtown to this spot and walked in surprising ourselves with a cozy and tranquil environment. Our server, Isaac, gave us some great recommendations on sushi rolls. We took his advice on the White Angle, Crazy Love and Tamashi on Fire. These rolls are a must when coming here. We are from LA, where there are many well know celebrity sushi restaurants. We consider this place one of our favorites. Thank you Isaac for your excellent service. We will be back for more in the near future and definitely send you baby pictures when we have a baby or two maybe three.
author: John A.

description:
We made reservations at 5:30 pm on a Sunday night, but came in earlier then expected around 5:20. When we first walked in it was very quiet and a cute modern looking place inside. The server was bussing around slowly through the bar and the tables when we got there. It was about three tables of two people and four people at the bar. At first our server/hostess didn't notice us until my boyfriend had to come up and say oh we have reservation. And then he replies "oh I'll be right with you. Sit here" , and pointed to the table directly behind the people at the bar. 

After we sat down , we skimmed through the menu and saw the prices are tad bit high. This is where I started questioning their service, because our server completely ignored us for the next 15 minutes. And he took an order at the bar before ours when the party of two rolled in after we sat down! We tried to flag him down and get his attention,however, he would rather put his attention SOLELY to the customers on the bar!! He kept tending to people at the bar as they kept ordering more alcohol! We looked around and saw this other server with her stank face was "off duty" sitting in the corner alone. We were hoping this server we saw was not a "lone wolf". NOBE HE WAS ALL BY HIMSELF !He was taking orders, doing the bar,and serving the food out! Don't get me wrong- I am a server too , and YOU ONLY HAVE ONE JOB! You have to mulitask and bust your butt off to get in orders while serving food out professional as possible!! I WOULD KNOW! If a customer is done eating their meal and sipping on beer to beer- I would tend to them after I take orders first of newer customers. MAKES SENSE RIGHT? No he served alcohol to the bar people again and again...then he took the other table order before ours and took the food out slowly to other tables.

 These people at the bar behind us, were getting really loud and that is when the atmosphere changed so drastically. It was the opera of obxnious drunks with the performance of poor service on the side. I tried to give him the benefit of the doubt and waited another 5 minutes until he got to us. He asked "are you ready to order?"Me and my boyfriend told him we were ready for a very long time and he replies "Oh, I was busy with other tables! Did you see!?" LIKE NO DUDE YOU DO NOT SAY THAT TO CUSTOMERS. You apologize and try your darn best to not make excuses when you work at a restaurant- especially, customer service industry! We blantely ignored his remark and ordered. We got the miso soups,chirasi bowl, gyoza, and chicken teriyaki. Food was rolling out slowly, but we became increasingly uncomfortable with the noise level. First the miso soup came and it was lukewarm, but had a balanced taste. Gyoza was very tasty, however, the teriyaki was very salty. My chirasi bowl was good, the rice was flavored, but I wish they listed what type of fish were in there. After we were done with our meal, we asked the server how long he worked here. He replied "6 months ". For me ,that's a enough time for a person to get into "the flow of work" and you should adapt to being quicker on tasks. I felt bad if I didn't leave tip even though I didn't think he deserved it, but as we left the restaurant - the sign in the front window said "now hiring servers".

 Overall, I wouldn't be coming back because: 1)it gets loud as hell in there  that you cannot even hear your own thoughts, 2)food was "aite ", 3) too pricey for portion/quality, and 4)the service was missing completely. The pet peeve I have is servers who "pretend" to be nice after you paid your meal while being absent the whole service. Don't let the nifty modern look fool you on this upbeat street. Please save your money and time!!
author: Annie L.

description:
I'm a fan of Tamashis. Eat there about once a month. Haven't met a roll I didn't like (except the one with cream cheese, but I think that's a personal preference). My go to: Red Hot Chili Pepper; Tobiko Island; Bamboo; Yellowtail Love; Special edamame; Tuna mango salad (use to serve with more fish on salad), and Avocado bomb.

Takes reservations (Open table). Trendy spot. Can get pretty loud when full. But I keep coming back.
author: David L.

description: I ordered take out with my friend tonight (this was my first time here) and the sushi was tasty but it didn't come with any wasabi, ginger or soy sauce!! I even asked before we left if that was everything we needed and they responded "yep!" My friend ordered tempura and there was no dipping sauce. So the whole meal was fresh but dry and bland. Would have probably been great with proper condiments.
author: Christina C.

description: Wow, delicious and customer service was great! We sat at the bar because there was a table that has reservations. The host told us we could sit there but only had 50 mins so we went for the bar where we had an hour and a half. Honestly though, I think we were only there for 35 mins. The sushi was DELICIOUS! Excellent quality and quickly served. We ordered salmon off the specialty menu and it was super over-priced but very good. All of the other rolls were regularly priced and melted in your mouth. We'll be back, thank you!
author: Heather C.

description: I ordered a sushi bowl with butterfish and it came with a side of miso soup from Postmates. The miso soup was extremely salty. The sushi bowl was very good, especially the butterfish. I highly recommend ordering the butterfish. It was flavorful and I wished there was a bit more. There were a decent amount of butterfish in my bown even though I wished there was a bit more. The rice was perfect and I appreciated the half of an avocado they put in the bowl. I can't wait to order from them again and even go to the restaurant.
author: Christina L.

description:
My friend who was visiting me from my hometown of Vancouver and I stumbled across this place while exploring the Marina one weekday night. We were impressed by the existing reviews of the restaurant so were really quite excited since we were famished at this hour. 

We ordered the clam miso soup, 2 rolls, and a yakisoba. WOW we were both floored by how underwhelming each dish was. For one, every single dish had way too much salt. We were thirsty throughout the whole meal. My friend couldn't even get through her soup it was so salty. We've both had much better Japanese food for 1/3 of the price. 

The worst part was that I had to go to the bathroom (1 stall) 5 times after that meal. I can't say for sure it was the restaurant, but I had the worst stomachache after I was done. 

The only positives I can remember: nice ambiance and our waitress gave us $1 off our soup for it being so salty... 

Summary: underwhelming quality of food & overpriced.
author: Emma W.

description:
I have had this place bookmarked since it opened and decided to go today since it was also the Union Street Festival. We totally should have gone earlier and we will def be back. Its right in the heart of the Union St amongst all the shops. Very posh set up with open windows and doors to give it a breezy and welcoming feel. they also have a full bar. We got 2 salads and sashimi. Nice portions and very fresh and quality sashimi. Only two small things - we got hot tea and they serve it in your own little tea pot. It wasn't as hot as we would have liked. Also we got our salads really quick but seemed to have taken longer than neccesary for our main dishes. We were one of 4 other tables and there were two sushi chefs. 

House Salads - $5 but they are actually quite big servings and just letttuce like a lot of other sushi restaurants. It's a 50/50 blend that comes with a ginger dressing. 

Spicy Tuna Tar Tar ($13)- my hub is rather picky about this dish because it never comes out to how he wants it sometimes. This one was delish. It 4 layers from the bottom with seaweed salad, a layer of a more sweeter and spicy tuna mix, layer of avocado, and then a top layer of tuna but it is mixed with tempura crisps. If you aren't a big fan of the risps like me, i'm sure they can not include it. it comes with a quail egg as well and also taro chips. great presentation and very flavorful. Hubs even liked the taro chips

Sashimi Omakase ($50) - So worth it, so delish, and so fresh. The cuts are just the right size and you get quite a variety including blue fin tuna, hotati, amaebi, monk fish liver, uni, white tuna, salmon, ikura, saba and a couple of other cuts and a spicy tako mix. 

Unagi Sashimi ($6) - I love a good piece of Unagi and this is what gave it that extra star. For $6, I got two huge pieces that were melt in your mouth tender and tasty. So delish and so tasty...
author: Tao Tao W.

description:
Avoid this place. Trendy marina sushi bar with terrible service and questionable sushi. Two experiences I'll share:

1) ate there with the GF, cups were dirty, water was brownish, service took forever, sushi was average, noise was deafening, super dark. $90 bill.

2) takeout: edamame was overcooked, sushi was fishy, teriyaki chicken was rubbery, and the to-go containers were all cracked so it leaked soy sauce all over my car and carpet at home. 

The next day I call them to tell them about the experience and ask how we can make it right. I spoke with the manager who's name is Isaac. After I described the terrible experience to him, he said he couldn't do anything about it. "Wait, aren't you the manager?" I asked. "Yeah, I am the manager but we're really busy right now. I can't do anything to help you so have a good night." CLICK.  $70 bill + $10 tip.

The sad thing is, I would have settled for a simple apology and maybe a beer, but the manager Isaac decided to take the arrogant path, ignore a local customer, and hang up. Avoid this place.
author: Luke D.

description: Tamashisoul is one of my favorite sushi spots in the city! They really cater to different tastes and are willing to mix and match their dishes to cater to individual tastes. Isaac and his team are incredible--and they're only getting better. There's no better bang for your buck for sushi in SF than Tamashisoul
author: Suzi P.

description: While visiting San Francisco, my BF and I searched for good sushi in the city. We found this place on Yelp a few blocks from our hotel. It's a place where locals eat at, didnt see any tourists. We came in during happy hour where some rolls were $5. We ordered the Las Vegas roll which was so AMAZING we ordered 2 of them. The phili roll and a few others. All in all we 6 rolls with dessert and the bill came out to $66 with tip. This place is great.
author: Krystina V.

description: This place was awesome all because of Issac! He gave each of this customers unique attention to ensure they had a great experience! I would absolutely come back because of this service!
author: Natalie C.

description:
Wow I am so annoyed I just wrote a long review and it didn't post or save. WTF YELP!? 

Going to keep it short now. Been here a couple times and always friendly service. The second time was because of their check in deal for a free cocktail with a purchase of a shot and their shots are cheaper than their cocktails! $6 Japanese liquor + lychee cocktail. Bomb. Ordered the butterfish lunch bowl and it was amazing! Gorgeous and a great deal for the amount of food you get. 

They weren't serving nigiri or sashimi the day I ate there. The friendly bartender announced it to everyone who came through the door and one guy was so annoyed he left since they were able to make rolls but not nigiri. Only me and another girl there at 2pm on a Tuesday and they close at 3. I've only been here at odd hours so not sure if this place ever picks up. 

Friendly service and affordable by Marina standards.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Great sushi, great location, interesting service.. Good luck making a reservation-they don't answer the phone or answer your email. 
Very reasonable priced awesome sushi!
author: Alyssa C.

description:
The food was bad and so was the service. 

First, we had fried calamari which was poorly done.  

Then, the sushi was gross.  Fish was not fresh and the avocdo was over rip. 

The service was slow and the tables are cramped.
author: Beth K.

description: There were good parts and not so good parts about our meal.  I was surprised that you have to pay for the green tea (and it's a tea bag, not brewed) :( We ordered a special roll as an appetizer, but it came at the same time as our food.  The roll was OK, which was not what you hope for out of a $12 roll. My tempura udon soup was very good! My husband's chicken yaki udon wasn't that good, though... A bit too vinegar-y tasting, and not much in it.  The atmosphere is nice, though, but the prices were quite high.  It was ok, but I wouldn't go back there again.
author: Leanne J.

description:
Great food, terrible service. Waitress was completely oblivious to us, weren't serving half the things on the drink menu - why are they on the menu then? 

Rolls were good, get the bamboo roll.
author: Brittney B.

description:
Have been here twice and am already obsessed! Favorite sushi spot in SF so far, and it's so well located for grabbing drinks or hitting bars post dinner. Excellent service from our waiter, he doted on us but not to an annoying extent. The restaurant itself is stylish and usually always pretty busy which creates a fun environment. I would suggest making a reservation here for weekend nights, they tend to get busy around 7/7:30. 

Favorite items so far: avocado bomb, bamboo roll, gyoza, tamashi on fire roll, red hot snapper roll and spicy tuna hand roll!
author: Alyssa C.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in the city - I can't get enough! I'm obsessed with their mushroom miso soup. Beyond that, all the sushi & sashimi is fresh and tasty. You can't go wrong!
author: Ana M.

description: The food is fine but I came in & ordered to-go an hour ago and I'm still sitting here waiting for it. Not speedy
author: Lisa H.

description:
My new favorite sushi spot in the city. I wasn't expecting it but holy CRAP! I've never seen anything like it.

Definitely get: Avocado Bomb & Spicy Tuna Tar Tar. The Spicy Tuna Tar Tar was probably the best combination of raw fish I've had in a really really long time.  Avocado, tuna, whatever that delicious sauce was. Oh my.

Other good things: Red Hot Chili Pepper roll, Double Shrimp.  The real winners here though are the specialty sushi.

Atmosphere: pretty casual and loud, it's definitely a spot where people go before going out. Super good and I will DEFINITELY be making a trip back to the Marina to go here soon again.
author: Reyana F.

description: Maybe it's Monday.  Rumor has it, it's not the best time for sushi.  Walked away with that not too fresh sushi flavor. Also I give the size of the rolls a baby sized question mark.
author: Edwin G.

description:
Had a 830 reservation for dinner on a Saturday night and this place was a zoo. 2 large parties, 1 waitress, 1 host who was doing shots with the large parties, and 2 sushi chefs for the zoo. 

It was loud, unorganized and loud. Known for their rolls so we tried the avocado bomb and tamashi rolls along with house salads. Food was mediocre. Service was bad mostly because they are understaffed. 

I would recommend UMAMI down the street for better sushi.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Extremely good and fresh. Their rolls are different from other sushi places. Love their combos!
author: Lina L.

description:
Went here on a Thursday evening with my daughter. We are visiting San Fransisco for a few days. My daughter really likes sushi too, so I was happy for the Yelp reviews and closeness to our hotel for this place.
