The restaurant was not busy, the hostess and waiter were very friendly. I'm not one to like too fishy of sushi rolls, so they made me a special roll with little crab mix. My daughter really enjoyed her sushi. 

Nice atmosphere, friendly and accommodating service. And prices were decent.
author: Angela C.

description:
What I ate: 49er roll (not on the menu), spicy tuna roll, samurai roll, avocado salad, Nigori sake
Visit date: November 8, 2013
First time? Yes.

Despite the fact that the waiter/chefs/restaurant forgot about us, their rolls were flavorful even without alcohol-enhanced taste buds! So yes, we ordered our food, the table next to us was seated and got their food before us, we asked about our food (cause no one seemed to notice our empty table), the table next to us FINISHED their food, and then we got our appetizer. I don't know if it was actually worth the wait, but this place is definitely worth a try. 

The spicy tuna roll is luxuriously smooth and carried a decent amount of spice -- not too much to overpower the fresh tuna flavor and just enough to please this spice-loving foodie. The samurai roll was a California roll with eel and salmon, topped with a spicy aioli and black tobiko. It wasn't overly glamorous with toppings but it felt like a party in my mouth. The 49ers roll isn't on their menu, but you can ask them to make it! They were spot on. Also, bonus, their sushi pieces are bite sized, unlike many a sushi joint with their oversized concoctions.

My friend and I wanted to try a beverage from their cocktail list, but they didn't have any on our visit. Out waiter recommended the Nigori sake -- sweet and milky. A good intro to sake.
author: Erin G.

description: I love Tamashisoul! The "special edamame" is delicious, with great flavor for the garlic lovers out there. Every roll I have tried has been really tasty as well: Double Shrimp, Bamboo, King Salmon, Tuna Love. They have some great sashimi options as well. It is a small and cozy spot and the service is efficient so it is always has been a great experience whether there to dine in or take out.
author: Derek S.

description: Very happy with the experience I had here. Came for drinks and apps with a friend. We got the tuna tartar as well as some other sashimi pieces and it was DELICIOUS! The fish and the other ingredients were fresh, the presentation was on point and the wait staff was nice. All in all the whole package. Next time I'm in SF I'm definitely coming back!
author: Stella C.

description:
You got to try this place. I'll tell you, this place is worthy. 
I lived in SF for more than 20 years.. Living near the beach made me as a sushi expert(the truth is, my tummy hurts when I eat raw seafood..but I can't resist the taste and texture of sashimi. Which means, I'm super picky on sushi, especially when it comes with the freshness. ) 

I have a quite good nose. I can smell well on everything or anything 
 For example, when I drink soju or sake when I am tired as hell,
 the liquor smells and tastes like a nail remover.
... I know that sounds weird but don't try to understand me. Because I'm like that.

When I first came in to this sushi bar I was quite surprise. I thought it was some ordinary sushi joint that smells like fish or vinegar. 
But since the entrance doors were wide open, I can scent the breeze air and hot sake. 
Since I made a 2 reservation on the same spot, we came here first for a family dinner as a 1st round of the night. 

To start with an appetizer, we had Spicy tuna tartar and Hamachi carpaccio which were their one of the specialty dish, the harmony of spicy tuna and avocado were sweet and buttery, it figuratively melted in my mouth.

As a yelp veiwer, I SOOO wanted to try their uni nigiri which was posted here before. Thank God they served the best full flavor of nigiri. The uni nigiri wasn't surrounded by nori as a roll or embedded with a chunk of rice. The rice were enough and the uni itself had the right(better) amount of the sweet and freshness.(my mouth is getting watery now.)

While we were getting stuffed by hot and chilled sake and beer which I couldn't resist, I was full but had to eat my sushi rolls no matter what. The tamashisoul's special sauce were a little too much for my taste but it eventually made my tongue wake up by the time we had 2nd and 3rd bottles of sake and beer. 
After a full dinner with my family, my old missed friends started to come in for our 2nd round to celebrate one of our pal's upcoming event of their marriage. 
And yes I had so much fun time with my good friends, it was a blessed and blasting night. 
I will come back whenever I visit my hometown. 



P.S- I didn't forget to have their sweet green tea icecream as a dessert. ;)
author: MixD.NA P.

description: Stopped by for a quick bite to eat and a drink or two, really enjoyed the quiet atmosphere.  Lots of really artsy roll options. Over all I would say 4.5 out of 5
author: Mr G.

description: The best sushi spot in the Marina. Consistent, quality fish with friendly and knowledgeable servers. They have a another omakaze spot in the mission that is a must try, Sushi Hon.
author: Micah I.

description: Vegetable teriyaki was amazing, smelled great too. So were the vegetable and sweet potato+avocado rolls. Not much for vegetarians but that was enough for me. Drinks were great too. Only thing is that they let only one Yelp check-in special per table, even though we had 5 people :/
author: Nitesh D.

description: Love this place! Great sushi and always really fresh ingredients. Has a really great atmosphere and the customer service is amazing. Highly recommend!!
author: Elisa V.

description:
Wow. The freshest, melting-in-mouth, tastiest sushi I've ever had, and I've had a lot of sushi because my dad was a sushi chef for a long period. I think the chef is the owner? And the servers are so kind! This place is pretty new and I'm so glad it's here.
I don't remember all of the roll names but it was all good. 

I gotta say their uni nigiri was also top notch. I've had a lot of uni nigiri,  But their uni nigiri was sooo freakin good. So creamy and it just melts in your mouth. I love the part that there is no seaweed wrapped around. 
Their slogan should be "FRESSHHHHHHH" because everything here is super fresh! Idk how they do it. I think they get there fish everyday. Love it, definitely coming back! Hope you enjoy!
author: Hannah P.

description: Such a delicious place! They were so accommodating and let us finish our meal even when they were already closing! Great food, full bar, great service! Highly recommend this place!
author: Anna L.

description: I'm giving this restaurant 5 stars just for having Walu/Butterfish. Lunch specials like a sushi bowl or their sushi wraps are a great deal, especially for the neighborhood it's located in. This restaurant is cozy and pretty much one of the two Japanese restaurants in the area. Some suggestions is the butterfish sushi bowl, their sushi burritos and their tobiko rolls. In terms of portion, don't expect a lot, it's a decent size but normally smaller than your usual sushi places.
author: Jan R.

description: This place is great! The fish was fresh and Isaac behind the bar pointed us in the right direction. The Tamashibo was great.
author: Travis H.

description: This is a great neighborhood sushi joint! Fresh sushi and their mushroom miso soup is a must try. Best seaweed salad I have had in a long time!
author: Ann K.

description:
So stoked to stumble upon Tamashisoul. 

I struggle to find good sushi in SF. Yeah, you heard me. Sure, we've got great omakase and live sushi - but none of it is affordable or easy to snag a reservation at. I'm talking affordable, but high quality sushi you could actually have a few times a week if you really wanted to without breaking the bank. In the South Bay, places like these are nearly on every other block. Since moving tonSF, I've struggled to find "my" regular sushi joint. Well, I've finally found it in Tamashisoul. 

Every roll we ordered was solid. Large portion, high quality fish and reasonably priced. The restaurant itself is inviting and clean. 

I highly recommend Tamasahisoul to anyone wanting to get their sushi fix.
author: Mandy A.

description:
This is not a review for the food. Why? Because we didn't make it that far. A few notes before the real story.

1. If you are over 25, you will feel old here.
2. If you want to have a conversation vs. lip synching one, go somewhere else - if a bomb went off you would never hear it. 

Now the short story and it is short. We sat down. The couple who sat down after us was asked if they would like to order an appetizer. When the server finally came over (after bringing us water in two huge glasses because she said that was "all they had.") we inquired about what kind of fish was in the Chirashi Bowl. We explained we didn't like shellfish and wanted to order some nigiri in addition to the bowl - and wanted it to be different fish then we were already getitng. 

The server's answer: "It's the chef's choice." When we asked what the "chef's choice might be." she looked at us confused and then said again, "It's the chef's choice!" We tried a third time and realizing we would never get the answer to what fish we were going to eat. We simply got up and left.

The server looked very surprised - but we decided that we weren't into mystery sushi. We won't be back.
author: Dennis S.

description: I went here for the first time the other night with a friend who lives in the area and I can't wait to go back. This place is amazing. It gets pretty crowded and can be a little cramped. We went on a Sunday night, and the only place they could find two seats for us was at the bar. We had no problem with this, as we received excellent service at the bar. The bartender was super attentive and very friendly, despite how busy it was. I ordered the "Tamashi on fire" roll which literally comes out on fire. It was AMAZING! It was definitely one of the best rolls of sushi I have ever had in my life. I also got a California roll which was delicious as well, but I can't wait to get back to try another specialty roll. My friend also greatly enjoyed her rolls as well, as they were also delicious. I will see you again soon, Tamashisoul!!
author: Alex R.

description: This place is great! The restaurant is small but the sushi is one of the best in San Fran. Ask for the real Wasabi if you're looking for a kick, the regular Wasabi doesn't have much of a kick. I tried the mushroom miso soup and I really liked it!  I can honestly say almost everything on their menu is good. Decent prices, food portions and a chill place to hang out. I will def be returning!
author: Noor S.

description:
First off: the server was very nice and prompt. the review doesn't' reflect him.
Second: I'm pretty sure my experience was further affected by the company and the food that was ordered.

Simply put: Overpriced for the lack of quality and flavor presented. There were three of us. We all ordered miso soup. Mine came out about 10 minutes before the other 2...the point of eating out is to eat together right? Next the chef's selection of sashimi.....not impressive and difficult to share since there were three of us and only 2 pieces of 4 fish. if it's a chef selection, I feel a little improv could have helped your case. not a large variety of rolls....everything had shrimp in it (which I can't eat, allergy).  perhaps if I were on my own I would have been able to better customize the food. I dropped almost $50 bucks for 2 slivers of fish and a miso in the end. Left hungry and unsatisfied. if the fish was fresh at least that would have been something. sorry.
author: Zara S.

description:
Not so sure about all these 5 stars...thought this place was extremely weak. Garlic edamame was a grease pile. Had the yellowtail nigiri as well as the bamboo and red hot chili pepper rolls. Rolls were plain BAD - tasted like something that comes out of the microwave, yellowtail wasn't fresh at all! GF and I ended up not even finishing half our dinner.

Try your luck elsewhere.
author: Will S.

description:
They have really nice staff here. Sat at the bar. They made small chit chat.

God. Avoid the mushroom miso. It was just too much flavor.

I got the sushi combo. It was alright. Maybe because I came in on Monday..

Overall, it's pretty basic here. Not a bad place to try.
author: Imma P.

description: Freaking awful. I love sushi of all kinds, and this place is just gross. They skip out on fish and overload with sauces
author: Amelia S.

description: Sushi was foul smelling & awful. We ordered through Postmates & had to toss the whole order out after tasting the Tuna sashimi. Disgraceful!
author: Courtney G.

description:
Who knew there would be such a great sushi place on union street! Both of our servers were both bubbly and friendly! 

The rolls were delicious and tasty. We didn't order alcohol there but there was a group of peopling who sat near us who seem to be drinking a bunch of different alcohols.

We ordered:

-Green tea
-Avocado bomb - Avocado really good and the sauce so-so
-Red hot snapper - This is flaming and the fish on top is great, so good!
-Bamboo - The sauce I wasn't a fan of but the rest was pretty good.
-Tamashi on fire - This as the name says is flaming as well and you must get!
-Vanilla tempera - This was surprisingly great. The batter was just like eating cake and the chocolate dress.
author: Derrick C.

description:
Came here for dinner with 5 people, 1.5 of us didn't get our dinners. Absolute hole w/ cheap fish and and even crappier service. This is the closest place to where we live. 

Never, ever again. 

The only way this place beats Naked Fish (down the street) for worst sushi in California is if the two pieces of my friend's dinner doesn't make us sick. 

After not getting my dinner, two beers were comp'd by our server - super, we'll use that 12 bucks to buy a burrito down the street.

To possibly not get your dinner - and if you do, have it be subpar - come to this hole.
author: Alex A.

description: Just another sushi place :)  Food and service were good, no complaints.  The 3rating comes from not feeling compelled to go out of my way to come back - just didn't leave an impression.
author: Nader A.

description: Very pricey, but super delicious! The flavors are amazing. Only had it to go so I can't speak to the ambiance nor the service, but do try their sushi.
author: cassy f.

description:
The fact that someone gave this place a 1 star review is just rude. Sushi tastes the same no matter your age and I've never had a bad experience here and have never heard of anyone else having a bad experience here either. It's by far the best sushi option in the Marina.

The rundown: Great service, GREAT happy hour, great sushi. That's all you really need to know.

Disclaimer: If you want to avoid people under the age of 25, this might not be your first choice.
author: H H.

description: 5 stars for good service, fresh fish, great food selection, cozy ambiance and the restaurants's cleanliness. Few of my favorites are: Tamashi on fire, garlic edamame and avocado bomb. They also have the freshest Uni in town. I'd definitely go back and I highly recommend for you to try this place.
author: Gwen M.

description: The sushi was on point. Manager recommended a bunch of specials for us that turned out to be winners. Would definitely recommend to others looking for a laid back sushi experience in the city. Good vibe, good food, good atmosphere.
author: Chris Y.

description: I've been waiting here 45 minutes for my sushi. Still not here. So bored. So hungry. The glass of wine I got after 20 minutes is okay though. Will update on quality of food if it arrives.
author: Emilie G.

description: Food was only OK. We ordered the sautes garlic edamame but told the waitress edamame cause we thought there was only one type so she brought the regular boiled one (she never informed there were several options and it doesn't show on menu). Only when we were done we saw that the next table got the dish we wanted. Food was very salty (and we love salt but this was too much).
author: Arie T.

description:
Cute little sushi place in a cute little neighborhood. There was room for our group of 7 and ample street parking (we went on a Saturday at 6:00pm)! 

I definitely recommend the gyoza and garlic edamame to start out with and for rolls: bamboo, double shrimp, Spider-Man, and the two signature rolls - which I can't remember, but they are the first two listed on the menu.

The staff was kind and we had quick service. Our total bill - including a 20% tip - was $153.  (We ordered 3 appetizers and 8 rolls)
author: David P.

description:
Decent sushi place.  I was went here solely out of my love for sushi and good yelp reviews.  Upon entry, the restaurant smelled fishy, not the good fishy, but not enough to turn me away.  The floors were so sticky that my girlfriend's sandals stuck a few times.  The server was rude and did not seem to enjoy working there.  

2 stars because:

Pros:
The fish was good quality, the avocado bomb was amazing

Cons:
The sushi came preseasoned (with wasabi? We were not told what it was, but he said "preseasoned"), the dishes were over-salted.
Lost points on cleanliness: my beer glass had dishwater in it, the diet coke tastes like dish soap. The floor was sticky and the server was rude.
author: Josh L.

description: I ate at this restaurant for 3 days in a row. Needless to say I am impressed with the quality of food and the friendly service. The fish is fresh and creatively prepared. The salads are generous in size and perfectly prepared.  Can't wait to return to San Francisco just eat at this place!
author: J C.

description: Fantastic atmosphere and very very very tasty sushi thanks guys for this! I wanna comeback again and again!
author: Valery M.

description: I've been here couple of times. Service has been consistently slow and food is average.
author: Miroo K.

description:
Let me start by saying that this 4-star review started as a 2 star experience, then moved to 5 stars, and then back to 4 stars. Basically, this dinner fluctuated more than any dining experience I've had in months, and one could say it was a bumpy road at times.  

The first faux pas was when our waiter went MIA after seating us.  We waited 15 minutes before being served even just water, at which point we were finally able to put in our request for the bottle of pinot. Given the slow start, we decided to place our entire dinner order at the same time.  Not only did our pinot not show up for another 15 minutes, the couple sitting next to us (who, I swear to God, were seated 10 minutes after us) got their wine first.  I'm not being childish, but when this happens at 8pm on a Tuesday night in a restaurant with literally 5 couples in the entire space, it seems almost comical (but trust me, we weren't laughing).  

Just when we saw the waiter finally approaching, it was to our disappointment to see he wasn't carrying our wine, but instead our miso soup.  A minute or so later, our wine came out....along with our 3 rolls.  You see, this sort of poor timing throws off the whole meal.  Part of the art of dining out is the perfectly timed intervals between wine, the starter, and the rolls, and while no one is perfect, I regret not enjoying a solid 10 minutes of just wine (and conversation, of course).  

Onto the food, and the reason this review deserves 4 stars as opposed to the 2 stars it started with: the mushroom miso was phenomenal.  It was light but almost hearty in a way I've never experienced with miso.  And the rolls! We had the White Angel (my favorite), the Rainbow, and one more which I regret not remembering (or finding on the menu as I review now).  It was crunchy and only mediocre.  Three huge rolls were just enough for us 2 to split and leave feeling super satisfied, yet not so much that we were running home to nap.

In retrospect, this meal was delicious and the company was fun, but the service was unreliable, and I hope for a more attentive staff if I ever go back.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Walked in at 2:40 for lunch. Waiter hands me the lunch menu which says "lunch specials, 12-3." I ask for a sushi wrap, and he goes "Oh sorry we stopped serving lunch at 2:30." I go, "Well your menu says 3, and it's only 2:40 anyway." He says, "Sorry bro."

So I walked out.
author: William L.

description:
I love this place! Everybody is so nice and the food is SO SO GOOD! I extremely recommend this place. The owners are so nice and will be your friend in a blink of an eye! If you're craving good sushi then this is the place to come!

COME TO THIS PLACE NOW!!!!!!
author: Claudette A.

description:
The sushi was awesome! And out waiter, Jeff, went above and beyond. Constantly checking in and refilling waters. 

We had red hot chilli popper, bamboo and special edamame. Everything was delicious and fresh! Def coming back
author: Oliver W.

description:
This sushi is the best in San Francisco. Can't count the times I've been here. There basic rolls are better than most places special rolls.

Unlike some places, they actually fill the saki up to the top. They're friendly as heck too.
author: Kevin W.

description:
The sushi is about 3.5 star quality. They used a lot of lemon to mask the flavor of the fish. We ordered toro and it was doused with lemon juice, usually an indicator that it's slightly past its prime. The market price for that order was $16.

I also accidentally spilled an iced green tea that they promptly replaced, but failed to tell me that I would be charged. If I had known that I wouldn't have asked for a second, so I took it out of their tip. Usually when you get a replacement drink without being told anything, it's implied that it's complimentary.
author: Eugene H.

description: Great service. Great sushi. Can't go wrong with going here! I hadn't been back in over a year because I live out of the area and both times have been incredible.
author: Delaney B.

description:
So..how many Sushi spots are in the marina, I counted 8 and I can honestly say this is better then most of them! Its not a fancy Umami, but I believe the quality and service is way better then Ace/MSB/M'sake/Naked/Yuzu and the others that don't need to be named. The friendly service goes way beyond being polite, we actually ordered our own special rolls/hand-rolls, now where can you do that!! That made me a fan and have been back since with the same great experience. Try the following: 

-Double Shrimp Roll
-Red Snapper Roll
-Tommy roll (Tempura/Avocado/Salmon and other goodies)
-Avocado Bomb
-Tobiko Island--different fish paired with special infused tobiko (fish eggs) 
-Tuna Carpacio---So amazing!!

2/23/18
The new Michelangelo hand roll best $20 I've spent!!
author: Kevin B.

description:
The restaurant was pretty empty so took a star off for the slow service. The waiter was super friendly and made conversation. Pretty cute place with a full bar which was a plus. My sister and I got the lychee martini and the mango martini and they were both made perfectly. 

Now for the food. We got three rolls which were the bamboo, red hot snapper and crazy love. They were all delicious!! I was so pleased with all three. My least favorite would have to be crazy love but that doesn't mean it was bad, just means it was my least favorite. We also had the shrimp tempura and wasabi shumai for appetizers Both were really tasty as well. 
Had a really great experience here. Will be back whenever I'm in the marina!
author: Shannon M.

description: Came here with my friend and we both agreed that the sushi was pretty good. I don't know why other reviews are complaining about the price. You pay for the trendy ambiance, service, restaurant location and delicious food. I will definitely come back again another time.
author: Couture A.

description:
5 stars for presentation: before serving my sushi roll they lit the outside on fire. 

3.5 Stars for taste: I feel like the fire did nothing. It wasn't even hot. I got the yellow tail love and another. It wasn't the best sushi but it wasn't bad.
author: My D.

description: I sometimes come here for lunch and they usually offer their sushi bowls which are really filling and tasty. The avocado salad was delicious and the dressing was unique. Their toro seemed fresh and service was good (they will check on you once in a while to ask if everything is ok and refill your glass without having to call for them)
author: Sui N.

description: Perfection.  Came with no reservations after a failed attempt to dine at Umami Sushi nearby, only to be completely surprised by the quality of food, waiter friendliness & price.  I'd come here in a heartbeat over other sushi places from now on, as the sushi here was fantastic.
author: Ben H.

description:
Outstanding maguro sashimi. Best I've had in years! (Ordered 2 servings FYI) 
The Salmon & Snow Crab #1 lunch bowl was excellent. 
Top quality ingredients across the board. 
HIGHLY recommended!

I only wish I had more time to eat. 

-JQC
author: Joe Q C.

description: I walked in for happy hour that they have between 5-6 on Mondays and Fridays. It took a few minutes for me to be acknowledged. I ordered just California Rolls which are comfortable when I have not had sushi from a restaurant. For some odd reason I could not taste imitation crab. Instead it really looked/tasted like tuna. Which isn't gross but definitely not what I asked for. Waitress/bartender didn't check on me much either. Don't think I'll be back. For such a basic roll I think it would be tastier at Safeway!
author: Courtney J.

description:
I've eaten here twice, both times for lunch, and both times have been underwhelmed. The food the first time was better than today. The miso soup was tepid and tasted old. The two rolls we ordered were okay.

The weirdest part about Tamashisoul is service. Ambivalent and absent minded -- both times we've been, the servers seemed clueless as to their role and what dining out it about. It wasn't busy, but all of the open tables were dirty and just sat the whole time we were there. At one point, our server plunked down a dirty wash cloth on the table next to us, where it remained for the rest of our meal. Made us both wonder what condition the kitchen is in.

There are definitely worse places for sushi, but with so many better places to go, I'd have a hard time choosing to come back here.
author: Terry P.

description: Best service ever, Jeff and Dan are great. The cab from Sonoma was perfectly described and full bodied. Calamari too!
author: Morgan G.

description:
I went there for lunch with my coworker. And we both liked it. 
We ordered Wild Mushroom Miso Soup. Miso Soup was perfect - perfect amount of salt and pepper. 
We also ordered Gyozo- perfectly fried with a great sauce. 
We tried two rolls, and we enjoyed every piece.

I definitely want to come back for dinner and try other rolls. And I'm absolutely coming back for lunch.

Enjoy!
author: Jenna F.

description:
Pretty fresh sushi. The sake clam soup was really delicious. Very fresh and great flavor in the broth. We ordered the sushi omakaze which came out to be about $60. It had fatty tuna, salmon, shrimp, uni (very fresh, no bitterness at all), and some other fish. Another dish that had really really complimentary flavors was the Avocado Bomb. The thinly sliced avocado, spicy salmon, and taro chips were really awesome.

The service was a little slow but I'm assuming they're still working out the kinks. The girl working the front should really deserve a raise the way she hustled and bustled.
author: Adelbert Y.

description: Creative menu and fresh sushi. But the service was a little scattered, though very nice people. And the music is way too loud in there. I think the servers actually couldn't here me and that's why my order wasn't fulfilled correctly.  If they improve service and lower volume of music, I'd give them a 5.
author: F S.

description: Favorite sushi spot in the marina for any day or time! Great service and nice clean atmosphere. The sushi melts in your month and the squid salad is exquisite!
author: Louise S.

description: I ordered the sushi bowl and miso soup for lunch. I asked for brown rice instead of white. They charged $3 for the brown rice and didn't even mention it to me. The miso soup was a joke. It was the tiniest container that was finished in two and half sips. $22 for lunch. Other then that is tasted pretty good but after going to elephant sushi for their lunch bowl it doesn't even compare!
author: Yana K.

description:
Happy Hour is from 5:00-6:30PM with 30% off classic rolls and skewers. The classic rolls are typically $7 so they came out to $4.90/roll.

No website yet which I would really work on quickly so people can see the wide variety of food this place has to offer.

Food:
+Mushroom Miso Soup- too salty for me, but they don't skimp on the mushrooms
+Seaweed Salad- pretty tasty!
+Albacore Tuna Roll- 8 pieces of flavorful tuna that doesn't need a soy sauce to dip it in. it was a tad too sweet for me though
+Vegetable Roll- pretty basic but they'll customize it to add whatever you want in it
+Spicy Hamachi Roll- pretty tasty and filling with jalapeno pieces on top

Service:
We've always been one of 1-3 tables in there so service was fast and attentive.

Ambience:
Small, clean sushi bar/restaurant. You can sit at the bar or at a table. The music is upbeat and I enjoyed it.

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description: I would totally give 5 stars based on sushi and service! The host was very nice and our server was a doll. However, it gets super loud when the restaurant is full and hard to hear people who are only 2 feet away. I will definitely go back but more likely to go on a weekday when it's less crowded. :)
author: Audrey R.

description:
The only reason I am giving Tamashi Soul a 3 instead of a 2 is because this isn't a bad hangout.  Sorry guys had to round down to 2.  Check my update towards the bottom for the reason.  When it comes to sushi though, ONLY come here if you are not looking for the delicate balance between quality fish and rice.  If you love lots of mayo and teriyaki sauce that smothers your sushi rolls, then this is the spot for you.  The beauty of the sushi is all in the eye and the mouth of the beholder.  This place is not for me.

The fish of sushi is suppose to be highlighted by the ingredients it is paired with but here it is the sauces that are the supposed stars irrelevantly highlighted by the fish.  They might want to take after Umami sushi and utilize their ingredients better to enhance the flavors and the proper contrast of delicate flavors.

If sushi smothered and overpowered by sauces gets you wet, then this is definitely the place for you.

Update:  Look... I gave you guys 3 stars originally, Min Yong C.  Take the comments as a way to improve.  If you don't agree with me then we can disagree.  I won't be hurt by it but you don't have to be sarcastic.  Judging by all the other reviews, you have a reason for everything that's bad.  For example, a few yelpers got sick after eating here on different occasions and you have the tenacity to blame them for maybe eating too much fish.  That is just hilarious.  Then some yelpers said sauces were too sweet for the sushi rolls, and you told them they are too sensitive to sweetness.  Some other yelpers claim some dishes were too salty, and you told them they are too sensitive to salt.  With the sauce issue, you are saying we don't understand sushi.   

In my case, messaging me telling me that you hope you helped me "UNDERSTAND" sushi... I really had no idea I just got schooled.  For a business that is not looking to improve through thoughtful comments from their paying guests kind of lands it less stars.  Note that in no way from my original review did I mention whether it was "authentic" or not.  I just felt that the sauces waaaaaay overpower the actual sushi rolls and fish.  The message sent to me by the owner is as shown on the bottom just hours after I submitted my review today:

Min Yong C.
Comment from Min Yong C. of Tamashisoul Sushi Bar 
Business Owner
12/9/2014  If you like authentic sushi, you can order our sushi & sashimi since we serve and season our nigiri & sashimi very traditional way. When you order items under design rolls which is very Americanized sushi, you should not expect it to be authentic. I hope this helped you understand little bit more about sushi.

I didn't know that walking into a sushi restaurant that it would be "American" sushi.  It doesn't say that on your menu or your signs.  Maybe you want to make that clear at the door.  Tamashisoul "Americanized" Sushi  

Your nigiri isn't much to rave about either.  I wanted to give less stars originally but thought that it's still a good hang out although not the best sushi.  After this run in though,  I can sleep better giving less.  Can't give a restaurant average or above it they can't respect their client's thoughts especially when they aren't unreasonable ones.  And please, I  don't even know if you understand American sushi, but I sure don't think you understand Japanese sushi.  Even if it is what you claim to be "Americanized" sushi, it still deserves balance in ingredients.  That's when it comes to ANY food buddy.  Good luck with your business.  2 stars.  You're lucky I'm not giving you a one.  

Still a good hang out.  Watch a game, drink a beer, have some American sushi.  

I won't EVER be back though.
author: Colin M.

description: My brother was in town and craved sushi so we stopped by for dinner on a Friday night.  What I liked about this place was that the menu is varied and interesting, and there is something for everyone.  We had the grilled mussels and the Avocado Bomb (delicious avocado, salmon, taro chips and amazing sauce), Chicken Teriyaki (very flavorful, with that chargrilled taste, and a large portion) and several rolls- Las Vegas (fried roll, what doesn't taste good fried, but it wasn't overly greasy), Spider Roll, and some kind of Yellowtail roll.  They gave us a complimentary roll which was actually one of my favorites of the night! We tried some sake too (don't remember which one); it was sweet and easy to drink.  Overall, we had a fantastic experience from service to proportions to food quality.  I will definitely be back in the future and would highly recommend this place.
author: Kari L.

description:
We called around 6:30pm on a Saturday night to see what the wait would be later that night. We were told around 20minutes and that is exactly what the wait was. We cannot believe we got into a sushi place on a Saturday night in 20 minutes. Most places have at least s 45-1hr wait in the neighborhood. 

The sushi was amazing. The edamame with garlic was delicious. We loved every roll we ordered and ended up ordering more because everything so good!

This is definitely going to be our new sushi spot!
author: Coco P.

description: We went here last weekend for my roommate's birthdays. The food was great: good quality and very fresh. Though it's definitely a little more on the expensive end for sushi restaurants you'd find in the Marina. The garlic edamame was tasty and I was a fan of the Tamashibow roll which is a rainbow roll but with lobster meat. Fun fact: they'll let you so sake bombs, you just can't drop the sake in the glass.
author: Aryn V.

description:
We ordered take out. The food was quite good with the chirashi don being very tasty and the rice (though less than expected) well done (not clumped or dry). The chicken yakisoba was very good but spicy and salty so not very good for my 8 year old. 
I was not satisfied because the stir fry noodles were at the bottom of the bag therefore warming up all the nice fresh sushi. Plus it was quite expensive and they also charged for the plastic containers to carry the sushi!
author: Jen C.

description:
A good neighborhood sushi bar. Fish is always very fresh. They have have a good list of options in their menu.

MUST Try - 
Spicy tuna tar tar ($13)
Red Hot chili pepper roll ($12)
Lion King ($11)
Tempura fried ice cream 

Average -
Tamashi on Fire ($14)

Definitely my go to place for sushi craving!
author: Payal B.

description:
This has been a great addition to the neighorhood. The owner and the staff have always been nice when my group or I have stopped by. I really enjoy taking a seat at the bar to grab some food, drinks, and watch whatever game is on tv. 

The sushi is really good. You can only get better by going to one of those spots where you have to make a reservation hours or days before. I would recommend it for anyone.
author: Justin C.

description:
Japanese food has been my favorite food for more than 20 years. My parents always brought me to high quality Japanese restaurant when I was young. Now, here, Tamashisoul is MY GO TO Japanese spot. The food is always really good. I usually order Sashimi and Nigiri only. (Sorry I don't really order foods from kichen when I go to Japanese restaurant, so i have never tried one here before). All Sashimi and nigiri, and rolls are perfect. Those are really fresh. If you want to try higher level of Japanese food, order UNI,AMAEBI,AND BELLY PART OF ANY FISH. Of course, i love tuna,salmon,yellow tail, or other basic fish. They also have lots of options to choose from. Even salad and Miso soup which are basic side options are also perfect.

FOOD: 5 STAR
SERVICE: 4 STAR 
PRICE COMPARED TO ITS PRICE: 5 STAR
ATMOSPHER/INTERIOR: 5 STAR
PARKING: 2 STAR ( HARD TO FIND A PARKING SPOT ON THE STREET )


NOW, IT IS TIME TO VISIT THIS PLACE. YOU WILL LOVE IT!
author: Chris L.

description: I just moved a few blocks away from Union. I found this sushi spot on yelp & fell in love. The sushi never disappoints. I've been 3 times in the last 2 weeks and plan on going again tonight. (I don't normally eat sushi at this rate, it's just that good). Even better than the food, is the customer service! Issac in particular, who works the bar most nights is AWESOME! He gives the best recommendations for rolls/ sushi to try. He also is always positive and friendly. I'm very impressed with his work ethic. I definitely thought this was his place by how he treats the customers. Highly recommend!!!
author: Sarah S.

description: Still outstanding! Jeffrey, the manager, makes everyone feel as though they're the most important patron. From the Tempura Udon to the newest menu items like the red hot snapper, this sushi bar/restaurant has everything you could want. Even more impressive, they're busy every night - I'm talking 7 days a week- they're always busy but the customer service is still excellent. Will be a loyal customer for many years to come.
author: Jonathan K.

description: I went to this place at the end of last month and kept forgetting to write this review for them. The service was very good, the waiter made sure we were always good, always kept our water glasses full (that's always a little extra plus), and was on it at all times. We ordered the tuna tar tar and eel sashimi to start off with, the tuna tar tar was really good!! I seen it was a big hit for most yelpers which is why we decided to try it, so thank you to everyone for the great recommendation!! I believe most rolls were about $10 but they were good portions, we ordered two rolls along with the starters for both of us and we were definitely full. If I have a chance to go back here I definitely would.
author: Erica D.

description:
The Avocado Bomb (avocado and spicy salmon) was beautifully presented and fun to eat.  (It involves taro chips.) And tasty. As was the white angel, a spicy tuna & albacore number. (It was in the more traditional roll shape.)

This place is all about the presentation, but the sushi I tried really backed up the image.  I'd happily come here again.  (Seriously, try the Avocado Bomb)
author: Kaite V.

description:
Japanese is my fav so im always eager to try new restaurants. This past saturday me n my bf had a craving for some sashimi n nigiris so we looked up on yelp for restaurants that were open after 1030 at night. Nothing around us was open considering it was a saturday night. So we ended up here. (Quite a commute) first, mostly i loved that it was open late!! Till midnight to be exact! Which i loved! Apparently you cant find that on a sat night in a big city. 2nd i loved the contemporary design of the restaurant in case you were planning to dress it up on a sat night. (Not one of those corner dive-y place) 3rd i loved the music!!! All about edm baby! 
Now on to the real stuff: 
I didnt think very highly of the service here. We came around 11 so i felt like the waitress was concerned about cleaning up before closing time. Not too attentive. Kind of slow with our drink order. Went to bar to ask for it. On the contrary, the food was pretty good. I ordered the bamboo roll ( spicy salmon ) i thought it was very good but the roll was pretty weak. I had to be cateful about picking it up without having it crumble onto pieces. My bf ordered the king salmon which was BOMB!!! I totally recommend it! Overall i would come back to this place because its pretty good food and the atmosphere is young and hip!!
author: Anudari K.

description:
What's to be said? It is very, very good and has a very vibrant scene wile you eat.
Jeffrey - our server was awesome - made great recommendations for someone that wanted to try numerous things on the menu. If there is better sushi in the Marina - God Only Knows what it costs. This place is reasonable and has amazing quality to choose from.
author: Christopher R.

description:
Thanks Yelp for the new find in my neighborhood! Never heard of it or seen it before, so wanted to try something new.

Everything was delicious from the edamame (pepper and salt!) to the 4 amazing rolls: Tamashi on fire, bamboo, red hot chili pepper, and shrimp dragon roll.

All were very flavorful and delicious, and neither of us could pick a stand out favorite! Always an amazing place when every item is consistently good.

I would definitely come back here!

It's about $25 with rolls, app and some sake. Not bad! If you're feeling adventurous and a lush, get the "buy a shot and get a cocktail free" yelp check in special! It was only Monday, so.... we passed!
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Finally tried this new spot, and I will not be returning.

I commend them for creating a pleasant decor, but the food was lackluster and the service was mediocre at best.  Not to mention the weird house music that was bumping at around 6pm on a Monday night...  Don't get me wrong, I actually really enjoy house music, but it just didn't seem right given the setting.  Maybe this place got their playlist from Mas Sake on Lombard.  Nonetheless, it was just plain awkward having loud house music playing in an empty sushi restaurant on a Monday while it was still light out. 

Anyways, the sushi was the opposite of fresh and our server was the opposite of attentive.

The sad part is, I already had low expectations before walking in this place - the only reason why we decided to eat here is because we were hungry and Roam Burgers down the street was closed for the day.
author: Juliana K.

description: Excellent service and fresh tasting sushi, but lacks flavor and richness. On the concerning side, there was a gnat in my soy sauce container and the bathroom showed signs of long term neglect (very sticky floor and no seat covers).
author: Anjuli H.

description: tamashi is best sushi place in SF! they offer very quality sushi and sashimi and foods are very very delicious! Also all waiters and chief are very nice :) i go to tamashi with my friends a lot! it is really nice place to hang out! (love their interior) They have good sake lists too! i highly recommend this place!
author: Grace L.

description: This is the best sushi place on Union Street and the Marina. The sushi quality is top notch. The menu has incredible variety and everything I've tried is awesome. Plus, they have a lot of great sake selections. Don't miss this place if you like good sushi.
author: David L.

description:
The quality of fish they served was just outstanding. Sushi chef knew exactly what he was doing.
Definetely a must check out sushi restaurant in town.
Ask for Omakase! Chef will surprise you! 
I will be back for more awesome sushi
author: Chris L.

description: Really awesome sushi rolls, teriyaki, and seaweed salad. Nice atmosphere, good service.
author: Page K.

description: Been twice now and it's something between 3 and 2 stars. Monday night is probably not the best time for the freshest sushi, but many of the cuts used in our sashimi and nigiri were tough and fishy. Service was friendly, but absentee. Water glasses were rarely filled, our waiter didn't check back very often, and the restaurant wasn't even busy. Prices are reasonable and the restaurant decor isn't bad. They do play thumping techno/dance music, though fortunately not super loud. TVs are at the sushi bar if you need to watch a game.
author: Jeremy S.

description: We started with the calamari - the cuts were long ways which gave it a more meaty texture, so good. We also had the fluke and albacore, both were incredible. Finally, we went with the lion king and tamashibow rolls and they were excellent as well. All in all, we couldn't have had a better experience.
author: Josh H.

description: Great food. Friendly staff. Issac at the bar was great. Will come again. One of the better, if not best Sushi spots in the marina. Do it.
author: Shelby L.

description: I live 3 blocks away from this place, so I've been here 5-10 times, and I say the same thing every time: Awesome food, poor customer service. The servers are nice, but it always seems like they are understaffed. Definitely don't go here if you're trying to get in and out quickly.
author: Jordan R.

description:
The servings were pretty small. There was a fish egg in our water. The second thing of water had sauce around the top. 

The King Salmon was very good. Chicken yakisoba was way too salty. Waiter friendly and personable. He drank out of some lady's soda because she complained it tasted weird so he grabbed her cup and sipped a few times.
author: Vivian P.

description: My friend and I were on a search for a sushi spot in Pac Heights that was still serving at 9:30 on a Wednesday night -- and we really lucked out with this one!! I am a sushi fanatic and declare this some of the best sushi I've had in the US (and I've eaten at Nobu). Between the two of us, we ordered the seaweed salad, the bang bang shrimp, the bamboo roll, the red hot chili pepper roll and the white sake tempura roll. All of the food was EXCELLENT and we were perfectly satisfied with the amount. The cost wasn't outrageous either. I rarely write Yelp reviews, but this time I was moved to do so. A gem of a spot!
author: Shannon E.

description: Great staff! Very friendly and helpful! Yummy sushi! We are excited to be here! Must try!
author: Samantha C.

description: The sushi here was really good.  We really liked their specialty rolls... They were delicious, especially the crunch Dragon roll.  We also had the seafood Udon soup and it was excellent!. Our kids devoured the tempura ice cream for dessert.  The whole meal was great!. The only issue we encountered was when we got the bill.  They had included a mandatory gratuity of 20%.  When we inquired about it, our server told us that it was a union rule and applied to groups 5 and over.  When we told her that this wasn't listed anywhere and we wanted to chat with the manager about it, they quickly removed the charge from our bill.  We wouldn't have had an issue if it was listed somewhere or if they had told us when we were seated.  I'm not sure if they were trying to gouge us because we were tourists....we were planning on leaving a bigger tip than 20% originally, but decided to reduce it after this incident.  Overall, the meal was excellent, but their tipping practices left a sour taste in our mouths.
author: Jason Y.

description: Updated review: good sushi and sake. Pricey but high quality. The Designer sushi rolls were rather good at 8 rolls for any one type on the list. The 'lion king' rolls were great. As a group we had two bottles of sake, one for $150 and another for $80. Please let everyone in your party know how much the cost of bottles you plan to order. The entire party is responsible for the bill. Do not expect the waiters to reiterate pricing or liquor listing, as they have different priorities. Overall, I would return to this establishment (and would bring along a pen and paper to tally a preliminary bill before ordering).
author: Nathan P.

description: I'm a huge sushi fan and this place is the best in town. Love the unique specialties on menu. My personal favorite is the avocado bomb! But coming from a public health background I think this place deserves 5 stars for healthy food options that are not only simply delicious but also very fresh!
author: Tina G.

description: Fried calamari is really good.  Charoshi (8 prices sashimi and sushi rice) is not bad and a good portion.  Street parking is not hard after 8 pm in week days! Staffs are friendly!
author: Henry S.

description: Great fresh sushi!! I had just had a couple rolls for lunch but they were delicious and light but with a kick! Jeffrey the server is a sweetheart and very funny and had great recommendations will definitely be back
author: Nadia N.

description: Best sushi I've had ever! We started with the spicy tuna tar tar, hamachi carpaccio, 5 pieces of sashimi. The server Minh recommended a specific type of sake for our taste. He is fantastic! Then we had the bamboo roll and the tuna love. Wow! Service and food is more than deserving of 5 stars!
author: Victoria T.

description:
My boyfriend had to work late this past Fri night and encouraged me to choose the restaurant that was near me. Well when he said that I knew I wanted sushi which is not his favorite but he knows it's mine. I wanted to try somewhere we both haven't been before. I'm so glad we did. 
It's a tiny place, but the modern decor totally makes up for that. There is a bar but not a sushi bar with a see through fridge of raw fish. It's an actual bar with 2 decent size flat screen tv's. 
We both immediately noticed how super friendly the entire staff was. We ordered a few rolls. I love rainbow rolls, it's always my go-to initial roll that helps me determine if their fish is fresh. Because if it's not, then I stop ordering sushi and just choose cook food.  Well it was great. We will definitely come back.
author: Myra M.

description: I continue to have really disappointing experiences here.  Last night included.  Called an order for take-out -- told we'd have a 30 min wait -- got there 45 min later to find out they hadn't put the order in.  2 other couples left the restaurant while we were there b/c of poor service.  Disappointing a company can get away with this and still not apologize for their error.
author: Lily R.

description: Delicious and reasonably priced rolls and sake/wine list. New favorite spot!
author: Fay V.

description: Food was fine, not amazing. Young businessmen running place didn't seem too interested in interacting with customers at 930 PM which I find odd for a Korean sushi bar. I would suggest closing earlier if it's that tough.  All other neighborhood sushi joints around do so.
author: Devon M.

description: Came in for a Sunday night dinner with a date. Perfect ambience for a easy layback dinner yet with a hint of class. Loved the staff; very friendly and didnt have to wait for anything. Definitely the top sushi place in Marina area. Also enjoyed their variety of special Japanese beers (Japanese ipa!!)
author: david l.

description: This place is getting better. Although I also rated it five stars in my previous review, I've never enjoyed my meal more than I did tonight. It was probably because my hubby is better at choosing sushi rolls than me and he handled the ordering this time! We started out with the avocado bomb and it was great. Then moved on to the white angel and the bamboo roll. Wow!!! They were sooo delicious and flavorful. We finished off with the tempura ice cream with vanilla ice cream and it was the bomb. I'm looking forward to my next visit already. P.S. The manger is very friendly and personable and makes excellent recommendations. The prices are awesome too!
author: Kelsey K.

description: This is my new go to sushi spot in SF. Excellent service AND food! Everything we ordered was amazing!
author: ArbeLe L.

description:
The good:  The folks that work there are very friendly and honestly looking to do a great job.  The waitress was very focused on making sure our glasses were full and the plates were cleared.  The prices were ok for San Francisco, and the portion sizes were acceptable.  We spent just over $200 for 3 of us and $70 was alcohol.

The meh: They are still working out their process.  There was a lot of confusion as to who should take orders, and often our waitress was not readily available as she was trying to pick up for the slack of the other trainees.    Though there were seats when we arrived, we had to sit at the bar due to reserved tables.  The reservations didn't even show up till we were leaving.   

The ugly: Food Poisoning.  I can't give any restaurant over 2 stars once that happens.  I was sick all night and most of the next day. 

Summary: For the price, you can do much better elsewhere.
author: Casey C.

description:
Please. please, please clean up the crap by the front window!  You did such an excellent job of making the place look great, but seeing all your delivery items and fax machine and stuff makes me not want to walk in.  Looks like a dumpy takeout restaurant, until you are able to look past that.
Also when you sit at the sushi bar there is to much stuff behind the counter... why?

and seriously... gross....walked by the restaurant this morning about 11am... lights out, no one there yet (not the problem) all the tables had old food and drinks left on them.....YUCK!!!!!  left dirty over night... leads one to believe that no one cares!

Thinking twice about coming here for dinner again... no, I'm not even commenting on the food or service... If your restaurants not clean, it wont matter.
author: Kallie K.

description: A bit pricy but very delicious. All the fish was super fresh and tasty. My only complaint is the ikura could have been bigger.
author: Liam S.

description: Best sushi in the world. Great costumer service, clean and nice environment. I well be back.
author: Bulya B.

description:
A friend and I were looking for some late night grub after some fireworks at the pier and we stumbled across this place since umami, a couple blocks away was closed for the holiday.  

The food was great, as an appetizer we shared the shrimp tempura which was fresh and crispy and oh man that tempura sauce made it even more enjoyable.  My only concern was that there were only four pieces, kinda eh for $7 right?  

As an entree I had the chicken teriyaki which was served with grilled veggies and your ordinary bowl of white rice and miso.  It was pretty good but then again I do wish the portions were bigger since that plate was like ~$16.  My friend had the classic eel sushi roll and she said it was just "okay".  For dessert I had the fried banana with green tea ice cream and I guess the fried banana was well prepared but the ice cream had this nasty-weird taste, bleh.

The service was kind of lackluster/slow while there weren't even that many people in the bar.  I really don't know if I'd come back.

So yeah, food is good, I just don't know about the portions.  Take your bet!
author: Jorel C.

description:
Great addition to the collection of Sushi Restaurants in the Marina/Cow Hollow neighborhood.  I came here around 7PM on a Monday and had no trouble getting a table for 4.  The restaurant is clean and the atmosphere is inviting and fun.  The Servers are very polite and pay close attention to your needs.  

We ordered an assortment of rolls and the combination sashimi platter.  I was happy with everything but if I could make one suggestion, it would be to take it easy on the Mayo and Tobiko.  I love sushi but I hate Mayo and I hate fish eggs and unfortunately, you can not order most items without it. 

I would go back.
author: Annie L.

description:
It's their first week so maybe there are just not ready yet...

We were there on a weeknight at 8.30pm. They took a very long time to prepare our food and actually forgot half of the order. We had to remind them twice and got it about 1 hour later. The sushi was not bad but nothing special. There is much better even around the Marina. The cocktail was undrinkable, which should be expected as one of the waiters was doubling as a bartender when it was needed.
author: Christos K.

description:
Worst sushi ever !! Sat at the bar you will see how dirty they are . How messy they work . They are not professional train . I didn't even wanna touch the sushi after they made . I don't mind they are korean , Please make it right !!

Didn't  even wanna waste any more time there , Went to sushi ran after.
Please go there , get yourself at the bar YOU WILL SEE WHAT IS THE WORST SUSHI EVER!!
author: Sushi K.

description: "They've got a lot to learn... Moved us mid appetizer and offered to comp us the cheapest appetizer which was overcooked, salty edemame. Sushi was run of the mill at best. Miso soup was ordered and never received but still on the bill. The lockbox still hanging on the door should have been taken as a warning. No need to go back again.
author: Sonia Q.

description: Looking forward to coming back!  I popped in for lunch and was served quickly.  The server was nice and outgoing and answered all my questions.  I told him I wanted the spiciest roll and he directed me to the Red Hot Chili Pepper Roll.  It was a good time, but not the spice scorcher or mouth burner it claims to be.  The server asked how it was and he brought over house-made Sriracha sauce and it was really good.  He also brought over 3 other hot sauces which I totally loved.  The server and sushi chef watched me eat the food in amazement and announced they had tremendous respect for me.  LOL!  It was hot, but it wasn't the hottest I've ever had.  It was good though.  I always enjoy myself when I'm there.  The Shumai Dumplings are a good time as well.  I definitely recommend this place.  One of the reasons I discovered this place is because it's like the only sushi place in the neighborhood open for lunch.
author: Shaun W.

description:
Not bad for a first try, Tamashisoul. I popped in with a gf last night for dinner around 7:30pm - we were able to get last min reservations without any problem. She chose the sashimi platter, which was a bit overpriced for the amount of food. Good mix of sashimi options (the salmon was particularly tasty), but the fish was situated amongst these huuuge piles of a curly white root-like vegetable. It felt like they were trying to disguise the fact that there were so few pieces of fish on the plate - it would have been a tiny dish if they removed the frills. Chirashi is my go-to at any nice sushi restaurant, and I wouldn't get it here again. The fish was ok, but they put a salad on top of the rice with a pungent dressing that I didn't like... it soaked down through the sushi rice and ruined the nice base flavor. I get that they're trying to be unique, but sometimes the true basics are better than the fancy presentations. 

I'd return and try the rolls, as there were several (like the Bamboo) that looked interesting. I wonder if they always have the same strange music selection... I'm down for 90s throwbacks like Spice Girls and Britney Spears every once in a while, but it didn't seem to fit the nice, non-crazy-sake-bombing vibe they were going for on a casual Wednesday evening.
author: Kelcey M.

description: should not rely on yelp that much, it is disappointing quality, very sad to see. sashimi was a disaster, one was not fresh and had stinky smell and some others were non-sushimi cuts.
author: S K.

description: Wow...fresh, creative food with great service. Try the sunomono salad with wasabi sauce and fresh octopus and bamboo roll.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
The go-to place for sashimi and is one of the only places who will make handrolls without rice.  The avocado bomb is amazingly great and has many flavors that work together beautifully.  Highly recommend the salmon sashimi - they have many kinds of salmon and they are all terrific, the salmon belly melts in your month.  The bamboo roll without rice is so delicious I could eat them all day!
On top of a great meal, the team is so nice and fun.  We love sitting at the bar talking with Jeff and watching the awesome chefs.  Min is the owner and is very involved in selecting the best fish.  
The ambiance is great and is also a fun place to watch a game or chill with friends.  
Overall, prob the best fish in the city!
author: Debra B.

description:
Great atmosphere and service.  Really pleasant people who showed passion for their food.  

Enjoyed the White Angel rolls and the sashimi platter.  Wine list could use some work, but had a serviceable chardonnay from 5ive Russians.
author: John K.

description:
This place is AWESOME.  

Best sashimi I've had in the city in a long time!!  Sashimi is fresh, delicious and just MELTS in your mouth.  Way to go Tamashi!  Can't wait to go back.  Had the white tuna, yellowtail, hamachi, salmon - mmm, want some now.

They also get 5 stars because they have fantastic service - Ginnie was soooo sweet and all the guys behind the sushi bar seriously knew what was going on.  MUSIC is also STELLAR - I must remember to go here when all of Union is quiet and the bars be playing those depressing beats.
author: Jana S.

description: Recently opened. Fresh, great flavors, friendly. Everything we tried was really good. Rolls at around $13 per roll are well priced.
author: K Z.

description:
Tamashii (two "i"s) means "soul" in Japanese. But Tamashisoul isn't redundant. Not only is it Union Street's first and only sushi bar (baffling, I know), but this place is pretty second to none.

Grand Opening weekend, and it was busy. Yet not too busy to seat us right away at the sushi bar. Jin ("like Gin & Tonic!" he told us) was the head sushi chef, and I must assume the owner. He was artfully putting together plates of sashimi and still had an eye on the goings-on around how we patrons seated at the bar were being attended to by the staff.

You could tell the staff were still learning, and there are some kinks to be worked out. But that's to be expected at this point. Jin paid excellent attention to us, and even asked if he could experiment with the sashimi platter he was about to make for us. Hello? Like I'm going to tell a friendly sushi chef "no"???

When the sashimi plate came, Jin told us what each type of fish was called in Japanese, and what he had done to prepare it. He also served us real wasabi. As if the sashimi wasn't impressive enough, the few rolls we also ordered were just as incredible tasting.

Welcome to the neighborhood, Jin. Very happy you moved in.
author: Brian T.

description: Had the crunch dragon roll which wasn't bad and the signature fire roll which was meh... Overall for the price would eat here again...
author: Jeff R.

description: Had the best time tonight. Avocado salad is to die for. The vegetable sushi was amazing.
author: Anna M.

description:
Recently in SF for on a Trip to Napa, for a weekend wine tasting. Decided to head to the city and found our selfs in Cow Hollow looking for Sushi. We ended up checking out Tamasjisoul. My wife and I recently had our son who was 8 weeks old - we arrived 15 minutes before they opened and Jeffrey allowed us to come in and get settled. 

The service was 5 star, the food was crazy tasty and quality of the sushi was perfect. I eat at some of the greatest sushi places, this place was as good as Nobu, NY. Which is another great sushi place. 

My hats off to a great dinning experience and being so accommodating to my young son, wife and I. 

Also to Note - Cow Hollow is a great walking neighborhood, with an active young adult scene 

Thanks -
author: Jason S.

description:
Covering everything in flavored mayo= not the answer for how to succeed on Union street. Fresh, clean, and tastes good is.
Rolls were ok, but drenched in sauce. Even when we asked for it on the side, it still made it on the roll.
author: Kate B.

description:
Absolutely amazing quality of fish they serve, very reasonable price for the quality, sweet servers, and nice atmosphere to spend some time with friends. 
everytime I go there, I see they are getting better and better. Truly the best japanese restarant throughout the town. if you just want little food or drink, still good place to hang out since they have delicious specialties and a very good selection of wine, beer, and sake. plus they make awesome cocktails too!! 
I highly recommand this place to everyone. I brought some friends here and they fell in love with tamashi :)
author: Diane Y.

description: We stopped in for a quick lunch today and it was delicious!  My husband got the tempura udon and I got some specialty rolls, which were both good.  The torched salmon was incredible.  I also got the Yellow Tail Love, which was good but I would probably try something else next time.  I would definitely come back.  Also great Peroni on tap for $4.
author: Reggie G.

description: review is only for lunch and it was to go. salmon tataki salad was really tasty. I liked th like smokey flavor of the salmon and the citrus vinaigrette balanced it all nicely. I think for what I got, it was priced okay. would have liked some more beets and apple to beef up the portion size a little more. will definitely be back to try more!
author: Susan Z.

description: Came here on a Friday night and I was surprised the place wasn't packed. We had a group of eight people and everything was delicious; a little spicy, but oh so delicious. I was also glad to see that the fish was fresh, because I love sashimi. I'll be back again. :)
author: Narina A.

description:
LOVED this place! Thank god we don't only have Umami down the street anymore. The rolls were creative and all of the nigiri was very, very fresh. Everyone was extremely friendly although service was a bit off (they are so new, though, so they should iron their kinks out pretty quickly). 

Wish they had a better wine list but will bring a bottle and be back ASAP.
author: Laura W.

description: Maybe it's the rice, or lack of skill behind the counter making rice and prepping. Maybe you should try harder?!  But it's supremely discouraging that you're proud of fish you select (and serve) and believe it to be clean, fresh, and healthy for human consumption. Get better.
author: Zach F.

description:
I give 3.5 stars.

The Monkfish foie gras was warm which brought out a gaminess.  It should be chilled.  
(Also, it is supposed to be a starter, but came out of order -- not a big deal at all, but just a note).  Some of the nigiri was great - the salmon was perfect in taste and texture.  However, the swordfish was a little chewy and I had to pull something out of it that wouldn't break down.  That has never happened to me before.  

I also had stir-fried yakisoba with chicken, and wow- the chicken was sooooo Dry.

The service was really nice so I wish this could be a much more positive review.  The atmosphere was a bit noisy and I could here the next table's conversation all too clearly.  (Not as noisy as Mas Sake though - but no place is!)

Overall, I was hoping to stumble across a gem, but Tamashisoul was a bit lackluster for me (especially after having really awesome Japanese recently at Gochi Japanese Fusion Tapas).
author: Cuppy C.

description: Love this place.  First time here.  Definitely not the last.  Excellent, friendly service and super tasty food.  The garlic edamame is my new crack.
author: Jay D.

description: This is a fun little new sushi place on Union.  The prices are great and the fish is really fresh.  They have some really fun rolls and I loved the garlic edamame.  I'd definitely go back!
author: Cori D.

description: I'm from LA so my standards for sushi are very high... I have yet to find a place in the Bay Area that is as good as the sushi restaurant  in LA. With that said this place comes close to it... The sushi here is the best "casual" sushi place I have had... If you want to spend an arm and a leg you can go to Pabu, Roka AKur or Ozuma but if you want a casual night out this is the place to go. They have a variety of great rolls but the service here is very poor. The waitress we had was very nice and helpful but there was only one other waiter and they were super busy so they were trying to keep up. I would come back or maybe get take out.
author: Ani A.

description:
I've eaten here few times now and decided to finally write a review, I like to try few times before I actually rate and write a review. didn't have to wait because the group i went to had reservation. The place was packed, but hey it was the weekend, just means food is fresh.
Place is awesome, like the music they play, the display on the wall is cool and its clean, like the tables, the bar area, and the restroom etc.
People there are super friendly and attentive.

The most important part of the review - the food. I'm not a huge sushi or seafood fan but this place, it's really good. Food is a form of art, and the way they arranged their plates looked beautiful and tasted good.
Miso soup was good, it wasn't too salty or chalky like sometimes you can kinda feel the miso soup power stuff, this place didn't have that. 
Tried the Tuna Mango Salad, tuna was fresh and wasn't fishy and the amount of mango that was in the salad was perfect, wasn't too much. It didn't take over the salad, but it was enough where i can still taste it, all the ingredients harmonized and complimented each other very well.
I had Tamashi on Fire, Volcano, Spider, and the Red Hot chili pepper roll.
The Red Hot Chili Pepper roll was especially good with spicy tuna, asparagus and jalapeno with tuna, hot peppers and yellowish orangeish fish eggs. again all the ingredients came together perfectly without one flavor dominating the other ingredients.
you can tell the chefs are seasoned chefs and knows what they are doing.
love this place!
author: Juyoung K.

description: It was different...fusion. I like my zushi puzzle but I'm glad I tried this place at least once. Had a ceviche type dish it was the highlight of the night, some of the sauces were too sweet.
author: Kiran J.

description:
Tomashisoul has a fantastic staff that is always friendly and welcoming. The sushi is creative and they use quality fish & rice. 

Affordable, fun and consistent!
author: Adam G.

description: Love Love Love this place... Issac is a gem and I can't say enough about him... The sushi is great. Everything we had was delicious. Love the atmosphere, seems to be the local hang out. Meet some wonderful people at the bar where we sat and there first time as well, and they loved it as much as we did.. Issac thanks for your professional and warm friendly attentiveness, it made our experience one of the best we have had in a long time, you're amazing.  AND WE WILL BE BACK !!!!!!!!!!
author: Gene H.

description: Food was so good. Get the avocado bomb! The teriyaki rib eye was great as well as their flavorful edamame & the tuna carpaccio. Sat at the bar with the friendly bartender Ryan. Be patient, the food is worth it.
author: Brooke R.

description: I always like to give my neighborhood spots the benefit of the doubt and have ordered take out at least 5 times from here.  Simply put the sushi is over priced and mediocre quality at best.  You can find much better in SF.  I went to eat at the restaurant by myself one night - it took 5 minutes for anyone to just greet me.  When I asked for a table for 1 (bar was completely full) she said she would try to find something.  Keep in mind half the tables were empty.  10 minutes later another couple walks in and gets seated right away.  I walked out shortly after since they obviously had no interest in my business.  Way to make it obvious how you feel about solo diners.  Won't make the mistake of eating your crappy over priced food again.
author: Seema S.

description: Amazing customer service. Issac and staff were very friendly, and accommodating. Highly recommend.
author: Meredith B.

description:
Been here a couple times now and this is a great neighborhood sushi joint! The atmosphere is nice but still very casual and relaxed with good music and good decor. The staff there is very friendly and always willing to make recommendations or just chat while you wait.

Definitely recommend any of the rolls and the hand rolls are delicious and spicy- always recommend this for people looking for good sushi.
author: Mike G.

description: Really enjoyed by 1st dining experience here. Great service, attentive staff, beautiful presentation, and the menu selection was top flight. Great interaction between customer and staff, friendly "sharing" atmosphere sine we were seated at the bar. Thanks KB for the suggestion following watching the game; I'll definitely be back for more sushi and the welcoming atmosphere.
author: Jim C.

description: Fast and very friendly service from the moment we walked in the door until we departed. Every order was very fresh and perfectly seasoned. This place as an all-around treat. Very enjoyable, lively atmosphere.
author: David B.

description: The food is 5, the service 4. But in my opinion only because there where too few waiters. The night I was there they only had 1! And it was next to packed. So of course next to impossible to be 100% on and not the waiters fault. All in all food wins. Avocado bomb is great. I will be back.
author: Hanna A.

description: The restaurant did upgrade their sushi and although the prices are still high, the sushi was MUCH better and so was the service. I love when merchants make an effort to improve themselves. Good job!
author: Wendi K.

description: Just threw out $100 worth of food - it was that bad.  Teriyaki was oily, thin and tasteless; the faux crab in the CA roll was a salad type and so fishy it all went in the compost. Never again! Absolutely second rate - too many better choices in the area. Go elsewhere!
author: L A.

description:
Decor: very nice
Liveliness : lacking, because the place was mostly empty
Service: excellent
Nigiri: very good. Yellowtail and Unami were excellent, but Toro was veiny, and chewy.  I didn't care for the overly sweet house soy sauce, so had them bring regular soy sauce.
Maki rolls: Not good. The spicy tuna and spicy salmon was overly mayonnaised, and was more like a paste of fish. And it was fishy, meaning it was probably not that fresh.
Menu: uninspiring

All in all, this place is just average. Walk two blocks away, and try Umami, which is one of the best sushi places in the city.
author: Saul F.

description: Awesome customer service! Ordered togo and was waiting for my boyfriend to let me know how much to get, didn't feel rushed at all! Came back after 10 minutes (he said 10-15 minutes) and offered a glass of water before I left! Will definitely return :)
author: Amanda L.

description: Waiter was beyond nice, really great energy, he convinced us to eat more with ease.  Good food !!
author: Rose D.

description: I like this place, and the vibe, bamboo role is awesome, and the staff are so nice, the only reason that I didn't go for 5 star was noise, people speak loud, and the structure of the restaurant makes it even worse. But overall I like there, and if I'm not in favour of silence, I'll definitely go there.
author: Yasaman A.

description:
I tried this new spot with my buddies and just loved it.  Tamashi on fire roll is rock!! I also ordered omakaze style of mixed sushi and sashimi (its a chef's choice) and they were so yummy and fresh as i expected.  

A waiter was kind and attentive to me when i ask for recommendation. Atmosphere was nice and cozy.  I will definitely come back here!!
author: Jae L.

description:
Stopped by for a late lunch 12/19/13 with a friend.  Service was good - we made special requests and they were very accommodating.

We shared the garlic edamame, which was delicious.
I had a special roll with yellowtail and tuna, wasabi tobiko, and some sauce on it.  I don't remember the name of it.  The sauce was a little much for me - a little too sweet and heavy, but certainly not bad.
I also had, by special request, a salmon roll with mango.  It tasted delicious.

We didn't buy any alcohol, and the grand total was less than $50.

Unfortunately, I cant rate this place any higher because I got food poisoning.  My friend - who had salmon and tuna in her dishes - did not get sick.  However, there is another yelp review here from a month ago where someone else got food poisoning.  For a place that's only been open a few months, this is too much.  

TL, DR: tasted fine on the way down, not so much on the way up.  Eat at own risk.
author: Andrea J.

description: My boyfriend and I just had. $85 dollar meal here that was worth $10. Flavorless and overpriced.
author: Meg O.

description: Ew. Yes lots of sake but $7 for a sub-par salmon roll? You've got to be kidding me.
author: Erin A.

description: Good twist on standard sushi, plus they open early for lunch, which is a plus!
author: John K.

description:
This place is super delicious!! I came here with some girl friends a while back and we had an amazing time!!

For a Friday night it was pretty busy! They have a really big cold sake selection which is nice and a lot of different Japanese beers! We were looking to get our weekend started so we ordered some sake bombs which were surprisingly affordable!

The food was fantastic! The avocado bomb is unique and fun to eat especially if you like avocado. Their rolls have a lot of taste, we had the bamboo, double shrimp, and spider and loved all three! We also wanted to try the salmon, yellowtail, and fluke nigiri which were all super fresh and delicious!

The service is great!! The servers are really nice and always make sure your glasses are filled, be it water or sake! They always clear plates and make sure you are doing well. Even the sushi chefs are nice! They also make sure you are enjoying your food even though they're busy and engage in conversation. It makes for a really fun atmosphere! I will definitely be back again for some sake bombs and good food
author: Michelle N.

description: I go here a couple times a month and it is pretty solid. Nothing crazy but great for the price. I would recommend the Avocado Bomb and Tuna Love. My girlfriend asked me to add that they pour a weak glass of wine. Beers are always the same size though....
author: Kenny B.

description: Pretty just below mediocre. It was loud from talking and the TV screens were awfully invasive.  The food was ok at best. The avocado bomb could have been so good but the overly sweet sauce ruined it. Their fresh fish of the day tasted fishy and old so we had to send it back. The server tried really hard to be warm and a good server so I appreciate that, but he forgot some of the order... Def don't feel it is worth 4 stars. I'd say it is more 2.5
author: Angela Z.

description: Was pleasantly surprised, love when that happens!  Came in on a busy Saturday night sans reservations and got seated right away.
