We ordered the bamboo roll, sushi combination, and salmon teriyaki.  Although the food took quite a while, everything was pretty tasty.  Loved the fun vibe and friendly waitstaff.
author: Brianna M.

description: This sushi place is my go to....for lunch or dinner. The sushi beats any of the sushi places that I have been to, and I have been to most. Their rolls are different and creative and the staff is really great. I would recommend this place, there usually is not a wait and is has never disappointed.
author: Gabby F.

description: the gal at the bar does a very good job of running the place. she's been there for at least a year. our favorite dish last night was the hamachi kama. the grill chef is awesome.
author: Sharon C.

description:
Awesome place, awesome chefs and the food blew me away. The service was really good , especislly the server we had who was friendly fast and very knowledgeable.  Her name is leah and she's the best

The sushi was my favorite due to its freshness and magnificent execution.  You can see the passion the chefs have and how thst is infused into the food's flavor and design. If you get the chence please try the fluke nigiri or sashimi and the king salmon roll. The hamachi kama is a good hot kitchen option, everything was really good.
author: Sebastian S.

description: Prob would never go here again. Sashimi was cut way too think and the presentation was slightly over the top. Took up half the table. Soda was flat. Rolls were ok but nothing special. I would def go back go umami over this place!!
author: Pamela R.

description: Great sushi! Super fresh and innovative recipes. Great attention to detail too! My husband and I are so excited to have found our new go-to sushi place. Ask for the classic combination if you are looking for a few rolls for just $13. Great deal!
author: Jen M.

description: This place is awesome. Food is great, service is wonderful and the ambiance is pleasant. Came here on a Sunday to watch the Warriors play and it was a really fun atmosphere. Highly recommend.
author: Aleksandra V.

description:
Probably the best sushi in the marina. The rolls are a little more exotic than your average dragon or rainbow and they are  extremely fresh. Great atmosphere.

I highly recommend it especially during happy hour- $3 peroni's!
author: Natalie V.

description:
OK, NOT great. 2.5-3 stars...

Decent rolls. Nothing special. 

What I did not like: Watered-down soy sauce; bad wine; undercooked hamachi kama, small rolls, LOUD TERRIBLE MUSIC. 

This has potential but I could not relax and it is run by a bunch of Bros playing TERRIBLE MUSIC (did I mention that?). Not how I want to spend my time. 

Umami down the road is 100% better and will BLOW your socks off.
author: Lady L.

description: I know I came here when the restaurant was still very new, but I had a pretty terrible experience.  Our drinks didn't come out until long after the food.  Plus, when we had gone to order our drinks they were out of ingredients for most of the drinks on the menu.    We had told our server we were in a hurry but that didn't seem to affect anything.  The sushi and drinks were good, but nothing special.
author: Katie G.

description: Great addition to the neighborhood. Bang bang shrimp and gyoza were amazing! We were impressed by the fresh sushi and wonderful service. Anthony was one of the best servers we've had in a really long time. Made us feel at home, great sake suggestion! Thanks for making date night so special!
author: J F.

description: Great energy place with top quality Service and Food. Seafood tastes soooo fresh. Now open for LUNCH. Always feel welcome here. Highly recommend!!!
author: Jimmy P.

description:
This restaurant made me write a review for the first time on yelp!!! 
Because im not good at writing good words for food. But im a sushi eater as like other asian. There are lots of sushi place iv been in sf but this place is different with others.it was special experience that i found this place . I was surprise that the fish quality was sooo good and fresh for the price. And it was fine dining and they served food in order like appetizer,salad,soup and main dish. I felt like they were watching me while im eating because all the food came out right after finished a dish by order. I had an avocado bomb as a server recommend, then had a house salad ,miso mushroom soup, for the main dish i had a sashimi combination which is like well set up course meal. And the specialized sake for sushi was fit for my meal as server Jeffry recommended. Besides the atmosphere and the vibe were beautiful and made me happy night!!  Everything was perfect since i walk into this place. I will definitely come here again. This is the real sushi place in sf.
author: HyeMin K.

description: This place is simply amazing! Charming and luxury decor, very friendly server and of course supreme quality of sushi~ Im not good with words so only thing I can say is come and try this place for yourself. Stop wasting your money on other place when you crave sushi.
author: Kwang Hee Y.

description: Great food, great service, great atmosphere.  Tamashisoul is a wonderful place to grab a bite of sushi or have a drink and relax.  Food is well prepared and carefully thought out.  Would highly recommend for a couples night out, or a quick bite before moving on.  Sushi is fresh and served either classic or creative rolls.  Several salads to choose from.  Brown rice served here!
author: Calvin J.

description: I was really hoping to love this place but, it just fell short on so many levels. Service was friendly but, two items from our orders were bungled. Second, they were out 2/5 things I ordered from the nigiri menu. Third, the flavor and quality was just ok... Nothing to write home about. The water in the tea pot came lukewarm, as did the temperature of our soup.
author: Jen H.

description: Hamachi collar was fresh, simple, and amazing. Went back to meet the chef to compliment him and was gracious, humble, and kind. Service was very good.  Shumai, and bang/bang shrimp apps very solid. Worth a visit! Will be back, and recommending to all fellow chefs and friends.
author: Christine J.

description: Such an awesome restaurant! Love this place.  Staff is super friendly and on top of it and the food and drinks are awesome! I highly recommend this place! Ryan the bartender is the best
author: Melanie S.

description: Yay for this new joint in the marina. Great food and great service. Our server gave us suggestions on what sake to have with our food and super attentive on our needs. Fav rolls were bamboo, tamashi on fire and white angel. Definitely gonna be my go to sushi spot !
author: Crystina L.

description: Stopped in on a busy weekend and they were very accommodating to get me a table even though the place was full and I didn't have a reservation. It is a small, but lively space with a great sushi bar. I loved the Red Hot Chili Pepper roll and the seared Tuna Sashimi melted in my mouth. The Uni (Mendocino, I think) was sublime! Attentive, friendly service made the evening just that much better. A must try neighborhood spot.
author: Markus N.

description: Tamashisoul is the type of place you want in your local neighborhood.  It is a hidden gem on Union St. where you can expect to be seated quickly, served promptly and be surrounded by a great atmosphere.  I have come with friends on multiple occasions and enjoyed all that Tamashisoul has to offer.  A special shout out goes to the avocado bomb and the Tommy roll!! Only at a "local" spot could one of your friends get a roll named after them!
author: Jenny R.

description:
The food was really good. Delicious. 

The things that weren't good are likely due to the fact that you guys are so new and are still ironing somethings out. I hope this helps you do that... 

1. the lighting at the bar is not good. it's cold and sterile due ot the blue lights and the overheads in the kitchen that are too visible from the bar. easy fix... get warmer bulbs, or shade the kitchen. 

2. the rolls aren't cut well and are very difficult to eat. I think this might be b/c the chefs are using saran wrap to keep the rolls together while cutting them, but i found in 3 of the rolls we had, the slices weren't really separate--the seaweed was holding the indivdual pieces together making it impossible to eat. big problem, easy fix... just have have the chefs take their time and do a better job cutting them. 

best of luck. looking forward to coming back and eating some more delicious food!
author: K D.

description: DO NOT EAT HERE.  I was looking for sushi on Union Street and thought I'd try this spot because the atmosphere seemed nice. The place was literally empty, and the host, Jeffrey, refused to seat my friend and I side by side at a four top, so we could both enjoy the comfort of the bench seat and watch the Pats game together. When I pointed out (at about 8 p.m), that the restaurant was empty, the host replied that it's the policy of manager not to seat two people at a four top.  When I asked to speak to the manager, Jeffrey replied, "I am the manager." I said, "so can we both be comfortable?" and Jeffrey said, "sorry it's management policy." Despite my obvious misgivings, I stayed because we were very hungry. What unfolded was a customer service debacle like I've never experienced in my life.  They delivered orders we didn't make with rotten smelling fish I would not feed to my dog.  They failed to fill my water glass despite several requests for water over a period of two hours.  There were plenty of staff on hand yet I felt all alone. If you like rotten fish and rotten service, this is the spot for you! I see at least two other Yelpers have gotten sick eating here!
author: Peter C.

description: Lunch review - It was before noon and i was the only customer, or maybe even the first customer. I was served hard & dry rice, unacceptable for a reataurant serving rice bowls for lunch! Please do not serve your customers old rice. I ordered to go so wasn't able to complain.
author: Sarah L.

description: We had an amazing experience here. Great sushi, cool sitting area and nice staff. The service was a little slow though. Will be going back to this place for sure
author: Pegah M.

description: Best sushi place ever! If you are picky on sushi, you'll never disappointed. Their sushi and sashimi is really fresh and all rolls are yummy! I love their atmosphere, it's good to hang out with friends and date out as well. Its kinda pricy, but its worth it. I highly recommend to try out!
author: Lani L.

description: A great  smaller priced option for sushi on Union. Food was tasty, sushi was good and  shishido peppers were awesome!  We have a little one, who was well  accommodated, there was a cool share table in front.  Place is good for  casual dates or  for a mid week  family  meal.  The only negative is that the service is a bit disjointed, but they are new , I'm sure it will come around. Overall a welcome addition to Union.
author: Brad S.

description: Bit too much like a sports bar for me--- loud and TV blaring.   But good service, sushi is decent
author: N S.

description: Update: Been back a few more times since opening weekend. While the food is still good, I would no longer give it five stars. It hasn't been very consistent and every time we go, the meals are different in taste, serving size, presentation, etc. I understand they are new, but each time I go back I get a little more disappointed...:(
author: April W.

description: I had high expectations of the place from reading other reviews, but I wasn't that impressed. The ambience isn't bad, but the service and food were mediocre. The rolls were smothered in mayo and "special sauce" so you could barely taste anything else. They also fall apart as soon as you pick them up. The sashimi seemed fresh but wasn't that flavorful. As far as service, it took forever to order and they kept forgetting things. It seems like a fun place to come for drinks, but I probably won't be back for food given how many other options there are in the area.
author: Kathryn S.

description: Meh, I've experienced MUCH better at the same price / style point.  If you're going to open yet another sushi joint, you ought to do better.  The staff is friendly at first but not very attentive.  We had several nigiri sushi pieces and the fish flavor was pretty dull.  Maybe it will work with the young end of the Union Street crowd because there are big cocktails and TVs at the bar.  I won't be back.
author: Laura H.

description:
Stopped in for a quick bite at the sushi bar tonight to try it out. Took 15-20m for anyone to ackmowledge my existence, and another 10m for them to return for my order. Yes they were busy, but still a total fail- service kinks should be worked out by now. (Noticed others having service problems too.)
I got mushroom miso, uni, and an avocado bomb. The miso was very good. The uni was fine but I've had much better. The avo bomb had interesting flavors & nice presentation, but the salmon inside didn't taste fresh. (And it took 30m to come out, I suspect bc server forgot to order.)

The lousy service may have clouded my view and I'm willing to give it another try, but I wasn't impressed.
author: Maggie Z.

description: Average,too much sugar in everything....Sashi cut too thick,rice was under cook and took foever.Shorthanded though the guy was very good....
author: Gilbert L.

description: Very good atmosphere and friendly service. My wife and I are sushi lover and this place is our all time favorite! They serve very fresh sushi especially super fresh uni. We also tried their kitchen foods and they were very delicious as well. I highly recommend this place!!
author: isaac l.

description: This place is very enjoyable.  Every roll was very good and reasonably priced.  The vibe and the decor of the place are also good fits for union street.  Especially liked the bamboo roll.  l would recommend strongly.
author: Shawn C.

description: Server did an awesome job. She was attentive but not overbearing. For me the ambience was too loud but other people might like that kind of stuff. The edamame was the best I have ever had. Sushi left much to be desired for me. My company thought it was good. I will say the red snapper is why I did not rate this at 3 stars
author: Jacob Z.

description: Wow what a terrible experience. I ordered to-go and when I got home to eat my sushi, the salmon was tough and chewy. I waited for bite #3 to confirm the fish IS NOT FRESH. The texture was such a huge turn off that I had to toss it. I figured I would call the restaurant up myself to deliver this feedback as they should know. The woman who answered the phone got very defensive and told me that the fish is always fresh. I was listening to this woman who was doubting my experience and told me to bring it back. I'm sorry - what? You want me to walk all the way back there to show you the fish you just prepared to me? Shall we do a cutting test? Sure I'll go ahead reach out of the garbage repackage it and walk myself up Octavia Street to show you...RIGHT. Then I finally asked to speak with the manager and he was much worse. Talk about poor customer service - he also wanted to see the fish. The most surprising thing is there was NEVER an apology for the inconvenience. I am a marina local and I will never step into this restaurant again and will tell my friends to do the same. I will continue going to Umami sushi where I know I can count on consistency and freshness. I rate this place a -10. Gross sushi and even ruder staff end of story. This place will be shut down in no time.
author: Sarah S.

description: I have sushi at least 4 days a week. I have eaten at most every sushi place in SF and this is the place to go. If it is not on the menu just "ask" and they will prepare it for you.  Great service, Great food!
author: Rod S.

description: I came here for a light lunch with a friend on a Saturday. I ordered a spicy tuna roll and veggie tempura! Since I didn't get anything to crazy, I would say that I don't have anything to rave about but there is nothing wrong with this place either. Staff was very friendly and their decor in the sushi bar is very nice!
author: Ranna K.

description: Been here during a business trip.. Love the sushi and the servers who helped me feel right at home!! Will definitely go back on my next trip.!!
author: Jaekyu K.

description: Came here last night with my sister. With the great variety of options, we selected the avocado salad to start, then had the Spider, Crystal, Yellowtail, and the Bamboo rolls. For us, I'll tell you the truth it might have appeared as if we ordered too much, but we devoured and enjoyed every bite along with sweet sake until nothing was left. You get high value for it because the sushi is excellent quality and especially for the cost. Great customer service - they are attentive and we never felt neglected. I appreciate the friendliness too. I didn't know how close this fairly new place is to me. I am making this my sushi go-to spot.
author: Naomi L.

description: Best sushi in San Francisco! I am obsessed with the sweet potato role!
author: Jennifer G.

description: Great sushi place with a great atmosphere. Creative rolls, good price point, and a lot of sake options. Solid addition to Union Street.
author: Kevin C.

description:
If our food had not been good, I might have just given this place ONE star because the ambiance is SOOO BAD. Let's begin...

On a Friday night, while looking at the menu from the street, we were skeptical about the music level but we were hungry and wanted sushi so we went in and got a table for 2 just a few feet from the door. The music was as loud - no exaggeration - as most clubs in the city. It was so loud that it was not enough for the waitress to bend over to talk to us. She had to squat down next to me to talk to me and move and squat down next to my boyfriend to take his order. And these tables are not big. They were closer to cocktail tables than dining tables. I asked the waitress if it was always this loud in here and she said during weekdays, it is more quiet. So I asked if they could turn down the music a little just so we wouldn't have to shout and she said no because the tables are so close that they need to music to be loud so that we don't hear other people's conversations. But we couldn't even hear our own conversation with the waitress! I looked down the row of maybe 10 tables and I saw maybe 3 people talking at that moment and it was STILL loud! I think they are over reacting. No other restaurant on Union Street has to blast their music that loud to facilitate private conversations. Do they think we're talking international spy secrets?? And if the number of tables don't change during the week, why isn't it just as loud then? I've seen just as many people there on a Wednesday without the blasting music. They should just own up to the fact that they want to have a showy hip club vibe rather than a restaurant.

This idea of "showy" comes up again later.

So we get to food/drink. I wish I could say more about the cocktails which I really wanted that night, but I can't because they DIDN'T HAVE A BARTENDER there. They were about one week old at the time and their bartender was already taking a vacation day? We settled for sake. Luckily for them, the food was good. We had a White Angel and Spider roll and one more roll I can't recall. The White Angel was the best. 

I do remember the table next to us got something that was lit on fire when it was presented at the table. I asked them later if it was extraordinarily tasty and they said no. It was good but not incredible. I asked the waitress what it was - their Tamashi On Fire signature dish - and how the flame affected the flavor. She said it didn't affect the flavor at all. It was only for presentation. Well, at least they owned up to that one.  

I might have wanted to stay and see what was up for dessert, but I was tired of shouting by that time. If they can control their image-consciousness and turn down the music, I'd go back often. As of yet, I haven't been able to bear it again.
author: Maria Y.

description: great sushi. home made low sodium soy sauce, fresh wasabi, fresh fish. can't go wrong. really good
author: Ribbon F.

description: we were walking by and decided to try it out...we were really glad that we did!  the garlic edamame was really good and then we had a few rolls all of which were awesome.  the Tamashibow roll (three sauces with four fish) was our favorite.  we really liked that the sushi wasn't largely rice, which is typical of a lot of other places.  the restaurant was full, but we could still hear each other.  we will definitely be coming back here.
author: Melissa G.

description: loved this place. nice atmosphere and rolls were so good!!!!!!!  i liked don katsu also. definitely recommend this place.
author: Grace L.
